title: AI Video Creator
description:
We’re looking for a dependable AI Creator to support our growing YouTube channels operations. We’re a media company managing multiple successful YouTube channels. We use AI tools to create content at scale (HeyGen, TubeGen, Kling, Seedance and similar platforms).



Responsibilities:

Creating AI-generated videos based on our briefs

Producing videos using tools like HeyGen, TubeGen, Kling, Seedance

Following script structure and creative guidelines

Basic editing and assembling AI video outputs when needed



What We Need:

Fluent English (written)

Responsible and meets deadlines

Can work independently and follow instructions

MUST have previous AI video work experience and portfolio



Contract & Payment:

Start with a simple test task (less than 15 mins to complete)

Transition to a weekly contract

Move into a full-time monthly role



Compensation:

$350 USD per month (full-time)



After 3 months, if both sides are satisfied:

? Increase to $
USD per month



How to Apply:

Please send a short video introduction where you:

 1. Introduce yourself

 2. Share your experience creating AI videos

 3. Explain why you would be a strong fit for this role



Video must be 30–90 seconds long. No more, no less than that (important).

You must also send links to your AI video portfolio.



Applications submitted without BOTH a portfolio AND a video introduction will not be considered.

title: Legal Case Manager (Personal Injury and Family Law)
description:

The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, proactive, and comfortable working within structured systems and procedures.

title: Graphic Designer
description:
I’m launching a new YouTube channel and am looking for a talented graphic designer to help build the visual brand from the ground up.

Right now, I’m focused specifically on branding and design — not video editing. This project is about creating a strong, cohesive visual identity that I can use across all platforms before I begin hiring for video production.

Your main responsibilities will include:

Designing a logo

Developing a cohesive color scheme

Creating a YouTube banner and channel branding assets

Designing profile images and header graphics for platforms like YouTube and X 
)

Creating a thumbnail style template that is clear, bold, and optimized for YouTube

I want all visuals to feel consistent and professional across platforms. The goal is to establish a clear brand identity that can grow with the channel.

This will begin as a project-based gig. However, if we work well together, I expect to need additional design support in the future as the channel expands. I’m open to building an ongoing working relationship with the right person.

Strong communication is important. I’m looking for someone who is open to feedback, can share creative ideas, and is comfortable discussing concepts before finalizing designs.

To be considered, you must include:

A portfolio with relevant examples (logos, branding, YouTube banners, thumbnails, etc.)

Your hourly rate

Applications without work samples will not be considered.

I’m excited to collaborate with someone who can help shape this brand from the very beginning.

title: Social Media Manager (Multi-Brand, Growth-Focused)
description:
We are hiring a Social Media Manager to handle and grow 5 brands across:



LinkedIn

Instagram

TikTok

Pinterest

YouTube

Other platforms as needed (must be a fast learner)



This is a structured, performance-based role. Posting and engagement must follow strict schedules and analytics tracking.



Time Zone & Availability (Non-Negotiable)



Must be available to post and engage in Los Angeles (PST)

Core activity window: 11:00 AM – 8:00 PM PST

Posting and engagement times vary by brand and must be followed exactly



Tools (Experience = Priority)



ManyChat

Metricool

Meta Business Suite

TikTok Business

YouTube Studio

Pinterest Business



Responsibilities



Schedule and manage content across all platforms

Engage with audiences at specific scheduled times

Manage automations and DM flows (ManyChat)

Track analytics and performance (Metricool)

Maintain brand voice and visual consistency for 5 brands



Attend weekly strategy meetings to:

   • Review analytics

   • Research trends

   • Improve growth

   • Stay ahead of platform and algorithm changes



Creative Growth Expectation



You will be expected to:

Engage with audience

Edit videos and photos to each brand’s aesthetic 

Create and optimize Reels, TikToks, Shorts, Pins, and thumbnails

Continuously improve visual quality and storytelling

Actively research social trends and viral formats (Think in growth, not just posting)



Probation & Pay Structure (Read Carefully)



3-Week Probation Period

Performance evaluation phase

* **No payment is issued until probation is successfully completed**

Starting pay after passing probation: $100



Pay increases based on:



  • Performance

  • Consistency

  • Growth results

  • Skill development

  • Opportunity to move into **performance-based pay**



You Are a Fit If:



You can manage multiple brands without losing quality

You follow schedules precisely

You are organized, proactive, and trend-aware

You respect time zones and posting windows

You want long-term growth, not quick gigs



This role is simple in task, but high in standards.

We are building brands, not filling feeds.

title: Salesforce Developer
description: We are seeking a developer who is an expert in Salesforce and has the ability to integrate various applications across our company. We are a scaling construction company that wants to streamline our process by leveraging technology.

title: AI Product Image & Shopify Listing Specialist (Fashion E-commerce)
description:
We are looking for a reliable and detail-oriented tea
mber to help improve and optimise our product images for our fashion e-commerce store. This role focuses on creating high-quality AI-generated product visuals and enhancing product listings to increase conversions.



This is flexible and relaxed work, but it requires a strong eye for detail and a good understanding of fashion presentation.



What you will do:



You will work on improving product images using AI tools such as Higgsfield and other relevant platforms. You must be comfortable creating and refining prompts to generate high-converting product images, including model images and clean studio product shots.



You should understand what customers want to see before making a purchase. For example, if a product needs an extra angle, better framing, or a different presentation to improve buying confidence, you should be able to recognise that and implement it.



You will also work inside Shopify to help optimise product listings and image presentation.



- Requirements:

- Experience with AI image generation tools (especially Higgsfield or similar platforms)

- Strong understanding of writing effective prompts for product visuals

- Experience working with Shopify product listings

- Good understanding of fashion and what makes products visually appealing

- Ability to think commercially and improve images to increase conversions

- Reliable, trustworthy and consistent

- Flexible and able to start immediately



Working Hours:



You must be available to work from 2:00 AM Netherlands time (CET)

This is 9:00 AM Philippine time (PHT)

The shift will be approximately 5 hours per day.



Compensation:



Hourly rate: $2.50 per hour



This is steady and simple work, but we are looking for someone with a strong eye for detail and a genuine understanding of fashion presentation and customer psychology.



Before hiring, you will complete a small paid test task to demonstrate your skills and attention to detail.



If you believe you are creative, commercially aware, and comfortable working with AI image tools and Shopify, we would love to hear from you.



Please apply with examples of your previous work and briefly explain your experience with AI-generated product images.

title: Public Relations (PR) Manager – Full-Time/Remote
description:
We are looking for a highly skilled and proactive Public Relations (PR) Manager to lead our firm’s media, publicity, and brand visibility efforts. This role is essential in strengthening our reputation, securing media opportunities, and supporting our attorneys and leadership team with interviews, speaking engagements, and public-facing initiatives. Candidates with experience in legal PR or professional services are strongly preferred.



Key Responsibilities:

Media & Thought Leadership

Identify and secure opportunities for podcasts, webinars, interviews, and speaking engagements

Prepare talking points, briefing documents, and professional bios

Build and maintain relationships with podcast hosts, journalists, and event organizers

Conference & Event Coordination

Research and recommend industry conferences and speaking opportunities

Handle logistics: registrations, booth materials, schedules, and coordination

Work with designers to create handouts, brochures, and branded marketing materials

Press & Publicity

Draft and distribute press releases for events, milestones, and announcements

Maintain press and media lists, track placements, and monitor PR activity

Serve as the primary contact for media inquiries

Testimonial Collection & Promotion

Collect written and video testimonials across all brands

Coordinate with the content team to edit and publish testimonials

Ensure all testimonials comply with legal marketing and ethical guidelines



Qualifications:



Bachelor’s degree in PR, Communications, Marketing, or a related field

3–5 years of PR experience (law firm or professional services experience is a plus)

Strong writing, editing, and media communication skills

Excellent organizational and project management abilities

Comfortable working directly with attorneys, executives, and media contacts

Familiarity with PR tools, press release platforms, and analytics/reporting

Knowledge of legal industry marketing standards is a plus



What We Offer:



Competitive salary + performance bonuses

Supportive and mission-driven team culture

Professional growth and development opportunities

Access to events, conferences, and networking platforms



Interested in Applying?

Please complete the application form:

??

title: PR Manager
description:
Position Summary



We are seeking an experienced and proactive Public Relations (PR) Manager to lead our firm's media and public relations efforts. This role plays a key part in enhancing brand reputation, increasing public visibility, and supporting our attorneys and leadership team with speaking, press, and media opportunities. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in PR strategy, event coordination, and media outreach—ideally within a legal or professional services environment.



Key Responsibilities



Media & Thought Leadership



Source and secure high-impact opportunities for podcasts, webinars, speaking engagements, and interviews



Prepare briefing documents, talking points, and bios for firm representatives

Maintain and grow relationships with podcast hosts, media contacts, and event organizers

Conference & Event Participation



Identify relevant industry conferences and speaking opportunities

Coordinate logistics for firm participation, including registration, booth materials, and scheduling

Collaborate with graphic designers to develop and print handouts, pamphlets, and branded materials

Press & Publicity



Write, coordinate, and distribute press releases for firm milestones, events, and campaigns

Maintain media lists and track PR placements

Act as a point of contact for press inquiries and media opportunities

Testimonial Collection & Promotion



Collect written and video testimonials from clients across all brands

Collaborate with the content team to ensure testimonials are edited and published appropriately

Ensure all testimonials adhere to legal marketing guidelines and ethical standards

Qualifications



Bachelor's degree in Public Relations, Communications, Marketing, or a related field

3–5 years of public relations experience, preferably in a law firm or professional services environment

Strong writing and editing skills for press materials, pitches, and media correspondence

Excellent organizational and project management abilities

Confidence in communicating with attorneys, leadership, and media professionals

Experience with PR software, press release distribution tools, and basic analytics/reporting platforms

Familiarity with ethical marketing standards, especially in the legal industry, is a plus

What We Offer



Competitive salary and performance bonuses

A collaborative, mission-driven work environment

Opportunities for professional development and career growth

Access to industry events, conferences, and networking opportunities



Job Type: Full-time

title: Online Communication Associate – E-Commerce
description:
Full-Time | PHP 38,000 – PHP 50,000 per month



We are a fast-growing international digital media company currently expanding our private communication team.

We are seeking dedicated, detail-oriented, and performance-driven Virtual Assistants who excel in written communication and understand how to create meaningful customer experiences through text-based interactions.



Role Overview

As an Online Communication Associate, you will manage private inbox conversations across digital platforms while maintaining a professional, engaging, and brand-consistent tone.



Your responsibilities include:

Handling one-on-one written conversations

Delivering high-quality, clear, and engaging communication

Strengthening customer satisfaction and long-term retention

Providing personalized content recommendations when appropriate

Representing the brand with professionalism and consistency

This is a performance-focused position that requires accountability, focus, and strong communication skills.



Requirements

Minimum C1 level written English (fluent, natural, and professional tone required)

Excellent grammar and spelling

Strong attention to detail

Typing speed of 60+ WPM preferred

Reliable and disciplined work ethic

Willingness to learn, adapt, and continuously improve

Full-time position

8-hour shifts

6 working days per week

24/7 operations (including day, night, weekend, and overnight shifts)

Flexible scheduling based on preferred time zone



Compensation & Growth Opportunities

Attractive performance-based bonus structure

Bi-weekly payments via Payoneer, Wise, or bank transfer

Long-term career development path (Team Lead, Trainer, Manager roles available)



Application Process

We are reviewing applications on an ongoing basis and hiring quickly.

Serious candidates only. We look forward to receiving your application.

title: GOHIGHLEVEL (GHL) EXPERT VA – SAAS BOOKING SYSTEM BUILD
description:
We are looking for an experienced GoHighLevel (GHL) Virtual Assistant to help build a SaaS platform called Braidli, starting with a professional booking system. This role is for someone who can BUILD systems in GHL, not just assist.



ABOUT THE ROLE

Braidli is a SaaS being built on GoHighLevel for professional hair braiders. The first phase is building a complete booking system, followed by automations and scalable SaaS setup.



RESPONSIBILITIES



Build booking systems in GoHighLevel (services, calendars, staff)



Set up deposits and payment logic



Create basic automations (confirmations, reminders, follow-ups)



Configure pipelines and opportunities



Assist with SaaS snapshot structure



Troubleshoot and optimize GHL systems



REQUIREMENTS



Proven experience using GoHighLevel



Strong understanding of calendars, workflows, and automations



Experience building booking systems in GHL



Strong English communication



Detail-oriented and able to work independently



SaaS or snapshot experience is a plus



SKILL TEST (REQUIRED)

Please submit the following:



SHORT VIDEO (2–3 minutes)



Your experience with GoHighLevel



One booking system or automation you personally built



Any experience with SaaS mode or snapshots



Your availability



SHORT SCENARIO (written or video)

A mobile braiding business needs a booking system in GHL with multiple services, multiple staff, deposits, and automated confirmations. In a few steps, explain how you would build this in GoHighLevel.



HOW TO APPLY- fill this quick application 



Only applicants who submit application and schedule interview will be considered

title: Finance & Property Operations Controller
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE & VISION



We are a growing property management company (Dream Cabin Getaways) managing luxury short-term rentals in the Tennessee Smoky Mountains and a long-term portfolio in Minnesota. We are moving from a "startup" phase into a professionalized "Operations" phase.

We aren't looking for a task-taker; we are looking for a Controller—someone who thinks like an owner, protects our cash flow, and ensures our systems remain airtight as we scale.



POSITION OVERVIEW

Salary Range: $525 – $785 USD / Month. 20 hours/ week ($6.00 – $9.00/hr for 20 hours/week).

Hours: 20 hours per week (Target: 9:00 AM – 1:00 PM US Eastern Time).



WHY JOIN DREAM CABIN GETAWAYS?

Growth-Minded & Solutions-Focused: We don’t dwell on problems; we find solutions. We want people who are hungry to learn, grow, and improve our systems every day.



Positive Energy: Property management sometimes involves surprise challenges. Pipes burst, tenants stop paying. It is critical that we approach our work with a positive attitude. We value collaboration, open communication, and a "can-do" spirit.

A Relationship, Not a Transaction: We want a years-long partnership where you feel supported, trusted, and empowered to make decisions.



Impact Over Activity: We value outcomes. You won't be micromanaged; you will be given clear goals and the freedom to execute, along with the support to be able to succeed.







YOUR WEEKLY FOCUS

10?counting & Trust Management: You handle complex deposit reconciliations (OwnerRez/Airbnb/Vrbo) into REIhub and generate professional Monthly Owner Statements for our PM clients.



60% Operations & Loop-Closing: You own maintenance from "Reported" to "Invoiced". You enforce the 24-Hour No-Update Rule, providing proactive status updates on all open projects in 
 without being prompted.



20% Financial Administration: You audit and pay contractor invoices, ensuring billed hours match agreements. You manage purchasing for cabin supplies to keep our "jewel properties" guest-ready.



10% High-Level Support: You provide expert backup for our STR Manager (Jeneff) during her time off.



Required Experience & Technical Skills

Experience: 3+ years in US-based Property Management is required. You must understand the "rhythm" and details of property management—from lease renewals to emergency repairs. Short term and long-term experience a plus.



Financial Rigor: Proven experience with Accounting for Real Estate including Short Term Rentals. 



The Tech Stack: While we use OwnerRez, REIhub, and 
, we value your PM and Accounting Experience over your specific software experience. If you are an expert in the industry, and familiar with competitor tools, we can train you on our specific stack.



Assertiveness: You are comfortable "chasing" contractors and tenants with a smile, and holding vendors accountable to their bids.



HOW TO APPLY

To verify your attention to detail and financial expertise, please follow these steps exactly:



Subject Line: Include the name of the original bass player for the Grateful Dead.



Cover Letter (Paragraph 3): Include the phrase "closing the loop."



The Initiative Test: Describe a specific time you solved a contractor or tenant problem without waiting for direction.

title: Global Virtual Assistant

POSITION SUMMARY

The Global Virtual Assistant provides administrative and operational support to executive leadership. This role is responsible for managing schedules, coordinating team workflows, supporting meetings and events, and ensuring day-to-day administrative functions run smoothly. The ideal candidate is organized, proactive, detail-oriented, and able to manage multiple priorities in a professional environment.



This position is 100% remote.



ABOUT CARDONE VENTURES

Our mission is to help business owners achieve their personal, professional, and financial goals through the growth of their businesses. We work in dozens of verticals and provide strategic business guidance through courses, live events, partnerships, and investments. Our core values are the backbone of our business and guide our hiring process: we are inspirational, accountable, transparent, disciplined, aligned, and results-oriented. This company operates nationally and is growing by the day.



Wondering what it's like to work here? Come check this:


/watch?v=PIIv7sYj1Ns

· Manage executive calendars, scheduling, and meeting coordination.

· Organize and manage logistics for meetings, events, and conferences.

· Assist with travel arrangements and itinerary planning when needed.

· Maintain organized records and documentation.

· Support special projects and additional administrative tasks as assigned.



COMPETENCIES

· Proven experience in an administrative or executive assistant role.

· Strong organizational and time management skills.

· Excellent written and verbal communication abilities.

· Ability to handle confidential information with professionalism.

· Proficiency with calendar,
, and standard office software tools.

· Ability to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.



PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

• Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer



COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY

As an equal opportunity employer committed to meeting the needs of a multigenerational and multicultural workforce, Cardone Ventures recognizes that a diverse staff, reflective of our community, is an integral and welcome part of a successful and ethical business. We hire local talent at all levels regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, or disability, and actively foster inclusion in all forms both within our company and across interactions with clients, candidates, and partners.

s, forms, folder setup, status updates)

What You Bring

Operations Coordinator / Project Manager



Ops Lead (EA-to-COO track for the right person)



We promote based on output, ownership, and reliability — not politics.



Our Standards (Read This Twice)

Do not apply if…

Training & Support

Clear expectations and accountability



A high-performance culture built on ownership and respect

Equal Opportunity



Infinity Clients is an equal opportunity employer. We hire based on capability, performance, and values alignment.

title: Appointment Setter (Warm Leads) — CLEAR AMERICAN ACCENT REQUIRED — Help Seniors Get the Care They Deserve
description:
Feel great about your work every day. You’ll be the friendly voice that helps seniors and their families get the **in-home care** they need — no hard selling, just guidance, empathy, and clear next steps.



Why this role matters



We’re a marketing agency focused on the home care industry, operating for 6 years and growing fast. You’ll turn warm inquiries into scheduled consultations so care teams can step in and help. If you love talking to people, staying organized, and making a real difference, you’ll thrive here.



Compensation and growth



* **Base:** $750/month

* **Bonus:** +$25 per qualified appointment you book

* **Recent performance:** The last person in this role earned $1,445 in a month. We’re actively adding new clients, which means more opportunities.

* Additional commission opportunities and performance bonuses for hitting KPIs.



What you’ll do



* Answer inbound calls from seniors and family members seeking help at home.

* Call back warm leads who fill out online forms — qualify and book them on client calendars.

* Act as a trusted advisor: listen, clarify needs, and guide them to the right next step.

* Keep records tidy: update Asana and our CRM so our Ads and Client teams have clean data.

* Join regular team huddles and training sessions to keep sharpening your skills.

* **Note:** This is not cold calling. It’s professional, caring communication.



What we’re looking for



* A **self-starter** with a friendly, confident phone presence.

* Reliable, organized, and accountable — you answer the phone when scheduled.

* Excellent English conversational skills; must be easily understood by US seniors.

* **Very important:** A clear, natural-sounding American accent.

* No experience? No problem. If you bring a strong work ethic, we’ll teach you everything.



How to apply



Record a short 2–3 minute video introducing yourself. Please cover:



1. Who you are.

2. Your previous experience (any kind — customer service counts!).

3. Why you’re interested in this role and why you’d be a great fit.



**The video is required so we can hear your phone presence.**

title: Part-Time Video Editor & Content Creator (12 Hours per Week)
description:
Part-Time Video Editor & Content Creator (12 Hours per Week)



- Hours: 12 hours/week

- Output: ± 5–7 Reels/TikTok/shorts per week

- Deadline: 24–48 hours per edit (after receiving footage)



About Us  



We are a fast-growing kitchen renovation company based in the Netherlands. We create high-quality kitchen transformation content for Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts by wrapping kitchens with interior vinyl. Our Instagram and TikTok handles 
 content style is satisfying, premium transformation content (high-quality before/after, clean visuals, smooth pacing).



We aim to have this style of content:  




==



Main Responsibility  



Your primary responsibility is editing short-form videos.



You must be able to:  



- Edit Reels and TikTok videos

- Create strong hooks in the first 3 seconds

- Add captions and subtitles

- Use smooth transitions

- Make before-and-after transformations look premium

- Turn raw footage into engaging short-form content



If you are not confident in your editing skills, please do not apply.



Workflow (Important)  



- You will receive raw footage + a reference style from us.

- You deliver final edits + project files (so we can reuse/edit assets later).

- You understand and apply current social media trends (hooks, pacing, sound choices, formats) and can translate trends into our brand style.



Additional Tasks  



- Suggest content ideas

- Assist with content planning

- Write short captions

- Schedule posts



Video editing represents approximately 70% of this role.



Requirements  



- Experience with CapCut, Premiere Pro, or similar software

- Experience editing short-form content

- Good English communication skills

- Reliable internet connection

- Available 12 hours per week



Growth Opportunity  



We are looking for someone long-term. As the company grows, there is the opportunity to:  



- Increase working hours

- Increase salary

- Take on more responsibility

- Grow into a full-time role

- Potentially become Head of Content in the future



If you perform well, you will grow with the business.



Payment  



We pay $3.50 USD per hour, starting at 12 hours per week. We aim to post 1 short-form video per day. Hours may increase as the company grows.



Trial  



Shortlisted candidates will do a paid trial edit (1 video).



Rights (Work-for-Hire)  



All edits are work-for-hire. Elite Keukens owns the final videos and may use them for organic content and ads.



How to Apply  



To be considered:  



1. Send 3 examples of short-form videos you edited.  

2. Tell us which editing software you use.  

3. Briefly explain how you would make a kitchen transformation video go viral.  



Applications that do not follow these steps will not be reviewed.

title: Executive Assistant to CEO
description:
Executive Assistant to CEO, AI-First Startup



Full-time | CST/PST Hours | Remote | Long-term



We’re hiring an Executive Assistant for the CEO of an AI-powered customer retention company backed by one of North America’s top SaaS mentors. This is not a standard VA role this person will run the CEO’s life, including inbox, calendar, travel, finances, health appointments, and operational support across two ventures.



What makes this role different:

•  Everything we do is AI-native. You won’t just use AI tools,  you’ll help build AI-powered systems and workflows. Your role will evolve as AI takes over routine tasks, and you’ll grow into a Chief of Staff position.

•  The CEO operates at high pace. You need to be someone who can keep up, stay calm under pressure, and proactively solve problems before they’re asked about.

•  You’ll have full access to the CEO’s life; inbox, passwords, health records, financial accounts. Trust and confidentiality are non-negotiable.

•  This is a growth opportunity. We’re early stage and moving fast. If you want a predictable 9-5, this isn’t it. If you want to build something alongside a founder, keep reading.



You MUST have:

•  2+ years supporting a founder, CEO, or executive

•  Experience using AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, Perplexity, or similar) in your daily work

•  Strong written and spoken English

•  Google Workspace proficiency (Gmail, Calendar, Drive)

•  Availability during CST/PST business hours (7 AM – 4 PM CST)



Bonus if you have:

•  HubSpot CRM experience

•  Familiarity with automation tools (Zapier, Make, Google Apps Script)

•  SaaS or tech startup experience

•  Notion or Asana experience



HOW TO APPLY:

Do NOT just send your resume. Applications without the following will be automatically rejected:

1.  Your resume/CV

2.  A 5-minute Loom video (see instructions below)

3.  In the subject line, include the word “LATCH” so we know you read the full posting



VIDEO INSTRUCTIONS:

Record a 5-minute Loom video (free at 
) where you:

1.  Introduce yourself and share your background supporting executives

2.  Show us a real example of how you’ve used AI in your work (screen share encouraged)

3.  Tell us what excites you about working with an AI-first company

4.  Describe a situation where you had to figure something out that you’d never done before

Compensation: Competitive, based on experience. Full-time position with growth into Chief of Staff.

title: HR Admin Assistant
description:
Work Schedule: Monday to Friday, 8am - 5pm Pacific Time

Work Setup: Fully Remote



Position Overview

We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented HR Administrative Assistant to support our growing remote workforce. This role focuses on onboarding support, HR documentation, timekeeping management, and employee engagement while maintaining professional communication with US-based clients and Filipino recruits.

The ideal candidate has strong HR admin experience, excellent communication skills, empathy balanced with professionalism, and the initiative to improve processes without constant supervision.



Key Responsibilities

a. HR Administration

• Assist with onboarding newly hired recruits, including documentation, orientation scheduling, and account setup coordination.

• Maintain and monitor daily time records, attendance, and PTO credits for 50+ and growing remote employees.

• Keep HR files, recruit records, and client documents accurate, updated, and organized.

• Ensure HR compliance with company policies and client requirements.



b. Employee & Client Support

• Conduct monthly or bi-monthly check-ins with recruits and provide structured feedback reports to clients.

• Respond to HR-related inquiries from recruits and clients in a timely and professional manner.

• Support employee engagement activities and help address concerns while maintaining policy compliance.



c. Coordination

• Work closely with recruiters, managers, and clients to ensure smooth onboarding and employee support.

• Assist in policy communication, reminders, and HR announcements.



Qualifications

Required

• At least 3+ years of experience in an HR Admin, HR Assistant, or similar role.

• Strong written and verbal English communication skills and comfortable speaking with US clients.

• Experience handling employee onboarding, documentation, and timekeeping.

• Highly organized with strong attention to detail.

• Ability to balance empathy with policy enforcement.

• Self-starter with initiative and problem-solving mindset.

• Experience working remotely with distributed teams.



Preferred

• Experience in a recruitment/outsourcing environment.

• Familiarity with HRIS

• Basic knowledge of Philippine labor practices and remote work policies.

• Experience supporting 50+ employees.

title: Webflow Developer (UI Redesign – Design Already Chosen, Possible Long-Term Role)
description:
--------------------------------------------------------

JOB DESCRIPTION:

--------------------------------------------------------



IMPORTANT – Design Is Already Selected



We already chose the design direction.



You are NOT designing from scratch.



You will follow a reference website (
) and replicate a similar layout, spacing, structure, and visual style inside our existing Webflow project.



We will provide all text content, all images, clear layout direction, and the reference design. Your job is to execute cleanly and professionally inside Webflow.



--------------------------------------------------------

PROJECT OVERVIEW:

--------------------------------------------------------



We are redesigning our existing website (
) inside the same Webflow project.



This is NOT a rebuild.



We are improving layout, spacing, typography, structure, visual consistency, and overall UX clarity.



We are keeping all URLs, all slugs, all H1 and headline structure, all keywords, all core text, and the existing SEO structure.



--------------------------------------------------------

SCOPE OF WORK:

--------------------------------------------------------



You will redesign the website layout by simplifying the homepage, improving white space, improving typography hierarchy, cleaning up service sections, reducing unnecessary animations, improving mobile responsiveness, and improving overall visual professionalism to give it an enterprise-level B2B feel.



You will also build two new pages.



The first is a Blog section using Webflow CMS. This includes a blog index page, a blog template page, a clean minimal design, and an SEO-ready structure.



The second is a Shipping page. This will be a static layout with proper internal linking and clean structure.



All content will be provided.



--------------------------------------------------------

SEO REQUIREMENTS (IMPORTANT):

--------------------------------------------------------



You must preserve URLs and slugs, preserve page titles and meta descriptions, preserve H1 structure, maintain internal linking, not remove indexed text, optimize images for speed, improve page performance where possible, and keep schema intact.



Basic SEO knowledge is required.



--------------------------------------------------------

TIMELINE

--------------------------------------------------------



Needs to be done as soon as possible.



--------------------------------------------------------

POSSIBILE LONG-TERM OPPORTUNITY 

--------------------------------------------------------



We are building a long-term brand.



After this project, we will need ongoing Webflow updates, blog layout improvements, landing page creation, conversion optimization, feature additions, UI improvements, A/B testing, and technical SEO support.

We are looking for a long-term website partner.

--------------------------------------------------------

TO APPLY

--------------------------------------------------------



Please include portfolio, your hourly rate and estimated hours for this project. 



--------------------------------------------------------

WORKING STYLE & EXPECTATIONS

--------------------------------------------------------



We are not looking to micromanage or make this stressful. Our goal is simple: build a clean, professional website efficiently.



We will provide clear instructions, all content, all images, and a clear reference design. We respect your time and want to make this as smooth as possible.



If you are reliable and communicate clearly, this will be a very straightforward and low-stress project.



We believe in long-term partnerships built on trust, clarity, and respect.



To prove that you have read this entire job post, include the word CONFIRMATION at the very top of your application message.

mbers is on maternity leave.

description:

Location: Remote

We are looking for someone who can think ahead, learn quickly, and operate comfortably in a fast-moving, founder-led environment.

title: Prior Authorization Specialist (Full-time and Remote)
description:
Role Overview:

We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Prior Authorization Specialist to support US-based healthcare practices. In this role, you will ensure timely approval of medical services, procedures, and medications by coordinating with providers, insurance companies, and patients.



Your work will directly impact treatment timelines, reimbursement accuracy, and overall patient experience.



Key Responsibilities

1. Prior Authorization Processing

-Review medical service requests and determine prior authorization requirements

-Gather and compile supporting documentation including medical records, test results, and clinical notes

-Prepare and submit prior authorization requests in accordance with payer guidelines

-Track submissions and follow up proactively to prevent delays



2. Insurance Verification

-Verify patient eligibility, benefits, and coverage limitations

-Confirm authorization requirements prior to scheduled services

-Document insurance details accurately to support clean claims processing



3. Communication & Coordination

-Communicate with insurance representatives regarding authorization status

-Coordinate with providers to obtain missing documentation or clarifications

-Provide timely updates to internal teams regarding approval status



4. Appeals & Denials Management

-Assist with appeals for denied authorizations

-Analyze denial patterns and identify root causes

-Collaborate with providers and payers to resolve issues efficiently



5. Compliance & Documentation

-Maintain organized and accurate records of all submissions and follow-ups

-Stay current with payer policies, CPT/ICD-10 updates, and authorization guidelines

-Ensure full compliance with HIPAA and US healthcare regulations



Required Qualifications:

-Proven experience in Prior Authorization for US healthcare practices

-Strong knowledge of CPT, ICD-10, and medical terminology

-Familiarity with US insurance plans and reimbursement workflows

-Experience working with EHR systems and healthcare platforms

-Excellent written and verbal communication skills

-Highly organized with strong attention to detail

-Ability to manage multiple cases in a fast-paced environment



Technical and Work-from-Home Requirements:

Laptop: 8th generation Intel Core i5 (8000 series) or better, or AMD Ryzen equivalent

Desktop: AMD Ryzen 5 (3000 series or higher) or Intel Core i3 (10th generation or higher)

Mac:

-Core i5 (2017 or newer)

-Core i7 (2016 or newer)

-Core i3 not recommended

Reliable work-from-home setup located in the Philippines

Stable internet connection with minimum 50 Mbps speed

Backup internet connection required

Availability: Comfortable working US hours (Eastern or Pacific Time Zone)



What We Offer:

Competitive Salary –  ?55,000-?60,000 per month

Paid Time Off – Take the time you need to recharge and unwind.

Attendance Bonus – Rewarding your commitment and reliability every month.

100% Work-from-Home – Enjoy the flexibility of working remotely.

title: Mortgage Operations & Executive Support
description:
Executive Virtual Assistant – Mortgage Operations & Executive Support

Employment Type: Part-Time to Full-Time (Growth Opportunity)



Sapphire United Loans is a U.S.-based mortgage brokerage focused on agency, Non-QM, DSCR, and investor loan products. We are building a high-performance, systems-driven operation designed for long-term national growth.



This is not a basic administrative VA position. This role is for a highly experienced mortgage professional who can operate as an Executive Assistant and right hand to the Founder.



We are looking for someone who thinks ahead, anticipates problems, builds systems, and treats the business like their own.



Critical Requirement: English Fluency and Accent



You must:



Speak fluent, professional English



Have a neutral or American-sounding accent



Have no thick or heavy accent



Be comfortable making outbound calls to U.S.-based borrowers, lenders, escrow officers, and referral partners



You will be speaking directly with U.S. clients. Clear, confident, professional communication is essential. Applications without strong spoken English will not be considered.



Required Experience



Minimum 3+ years in the mortgage industry

5+ years preferred



Strong loan processing experience is required.



You must understand:



Conventional, FHA, and VA loans



Underwriting conditions (PTD and PTF)



Document review and file organization



Income documentation basics



Clearing conditions efficiently



Communication with lenders, title, and escrow



Loan disclosures and general fee structure



Experience with Non-QM and DSCR loans is a plus.

Experience with ARIVE or other LOS systems is a plus.



Primary Responsibilities



Mortgage Operations and Processing Support



Assist in setting up and organizing loan files



Review and help clear underwriting conditions



Communicate with borrowers regarding missing documentation



Coordinate with lenders, escrow, and title companies



Ensure files are complete and submission-ready



Help maintain compliance and quality control



Systems and Operations Development



Assist in building internal operations from the ground up



Help create and organize fee templates



Improve workflows within CRM and LOS systems



Identify inefficiencies and recommend improvements



Help create SOPs and documented processes



Executive-Level Support



Act as the Founder’s right hand



Anticipate needs before being asked



Track deadlines and critical items



Stay ahead of potential problems



Help structure priorities and improve operational flow



Ideal Candidate Profile



You:



Think proactively and strategically



Are extremely detail-oriented



See problems before they happen



Take ownership without being micromanaged



Want long-term growth and responsibility



Are comfortable operating at a high level



This role has the potential to grow into a full-time Executive Assistant or Operations Manager position for the right candidate.



Compensation



Compensation will be competitive and based on experience. Long-term stability and growth will be available for candidates who demonstrate ownership, reliability, and strong performance.



Application Instructions



To be considered, you must follow all instructions exactly. Applications that do not follow instructions will not be reviewed.



Subject Line



Use this exact subject line:



SUL Executive Ops – [Your Full Name] – $3.5M File



Video Introduction (Required)



Submit a 2–3 minute video answering:



Your total years of mortgage experience



Your loan processing experience



Types of loans you have handled



Why you believe you can operate as an executive-level assistant and not just a task-based VA



This video will be used to evaluate communication clarity, accent neutrality, confidence, and professionalism.



Voice Recording (Required)



Record yourself reading the following exactly:



“Hi John, this is [Your Name] calling on behalf of Sapphire United Loans. I’m reaching out regarding the documents we’re still missing for your loan file. When you have a 
nt today, please upload your most recent paystubs and bank statement so we can keep your file moving forward. If you have any questions, feel free to call me back. Thank you.”



Processing Knowledge Question (Written Response)



Answer the following:



You submit a conventional loan and underwriting conditions return for:



Updated paystub



Letter of Explanation for a large deposit



Verification of Deposit



Updated homeowners insurance



Verification of Employment



Explain:



How you would organize clearing these conditions



What order you would prioritize them in



What you would communicate to the borrower



Systems Thinking Question



If you joined a mortgage brokerage that did not yet have strong systems in place, what are the first three operational improvements you would implement?



Confirmation Statement



Include the following sentence somewhere in your application:



I am ready to operate at a high level and treat this business like my own.



Only serious, experienced candidates should apply.

title: EMAIL MARKETING SPECIALIST - KLAVIYO (REMOTE)
description:

Industry: E-commerce (tactical foam blasters and accessories)

Hours: Part-time to start, potential for full-time

Compensation: $
/month USD depending on experience





ABOUT US



BrickArsenal sells tactical foam blasters and accessories modeled after weapons from popular video games. We currently generate approximately $48K/month and are scaling toward $100K/month.
 is a key growth channel for us.





THE ROLE



We need someone who can own our
 marketing strategy, not just execute campaigns we hand you. Our Klaviyo flows currently generate 79% of our

- Proven track record improving
 conversion rates (not just open rates)

- Strong written English

- Can work independently and bring ideas to the table

Bonus: Experience with SMS marketing, Shopify integration, or subscription products





WHAT SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE



In your first 90 days, we expect you to audit all existing flows and implement improvements, establish a consistent campaign calendar, run at least 3 structured offer tests, and show measurable improvement in placed order rate.

We respond to all qualified applications within 5 business days.

title: Data Engineer
description:
We are seeking a highly driven, hands-on Data Engineer to own and execute our end-to-end data architecture — from requirements definition to system design, implementation, deployment, and long-term operations.

You will build and operate scalable, production-grade data infrastructure that powers analytics, AI systems, and GIS workloads. This role requires both strong engineering fundamentals and a DevOps mindset — you will not only build systems, but deploy, monitor, and maintain them in cloud environments.



Key Responsibilities

 End-to-End Data Ownership

- Translate business and product requirements into scalable technical solutions

- Design clean, maintainable data architecture and workflows

- Implement robust ETL/ELT pipelines

- Ensure long-term maintainability, monitoring, and optimization

- Own deployment, reliability, and ongoing operations



Cloud Infrastructure & DevOps

- Architect and manage cloud infrastructure on Google Cloud Platform (GCP)

- Work with Firebase and managed services

- Containerize and deploy services using Docker

- Implement CI/CD workflows using GitHub

- Ensure high availability, scalability, and cost efficiency

- Establish logging, monitoring, and data governance standards



Data Engineering & Systems

- Build and maintain batch and streaming pipelines

- Design and optimize PostgreSQL schemas, indexing, and performance

- Implement data validation, observability, and reliability checks

- Support AI-driven and GIS-based data workflows



Must-Have Technical Skills

Hands-on production experience with:

- PostgreSQL (schema design, indexing, performance tuning)

- Python (modern dependency management, uv preferred)

- Google Cloud Platform (GCP)

- Firebase

- Docker (containerization & deployment)

- GitHub (version control, CI/CD workflows)

You must be capable of independently deploying and maintaining systems in production.



Nice to Have (Strong Plus)

Experience with GIS / Geospatial systems, such as:

- Shapely

- QGIS

- GDAL

- GeoPandas

- H3

- Google Maps API

Experience working with spatial datasets, spatial indexing, or map-based analytics is a significant advantage.



Experience Requirements

- 3–5 years of experience in Data Engineering or related roles

- Strong foundation in data systems and backend software engineering

- Experience building and operating production-grade systems

- Experience working with cloud-native architectures



Soft Skills

- Fluent in English (written and spoken)

- Clear, structured communicator

- Collaborative, low-ego, team-first mindset

- Self-driven and proactive

- Strong ownership mentality — you finish what you start

- Comfortable leveraging AI-assisted coding tools to improve productivity



Preferred Background

- Experience working in remote or distributed teams

- Startup or fast-paced environment experience

- Exposure to AI-coding



Submit your application along with your resume and portfolio link in a google drive link.

title: Sales Development Representative
description:

title: Outbound Hunter / Appointment Setter for High Ticket Sales Agency
description:
We partner exclusively with high-ticket direct response brands (Fitness, Coaching, BizOp) running offers between $5,000 and $20,000+ with 30-day deal cycles.



Our clients are spending $50k+ a month on ads and they are drowning. We don't sell them "closers," we sell them a system to fix their leaky pipelines.



The Mission:

Your only job is to find these whales and book them for a Pipeline Stress Test. You are targeting founders who have the lead flow but lack the infrastructure to handle it.



Application Requirement (Do not ignore):

If you send a resume, I’m deleting it. To get an interview, answer these 3 things:



How are you going to find companies running $5k - $20k offers that are currently scaling their ad spend? Tell me exactly which tools or footprints you look for to prove they are a "Whale" and not a "Dog."



How do you target a founder who is currently getting 100+ DMs a day? What is your specific angle to get them to hand over their CRM data for an audit?



Explain your understanding of a 30-day high-ticket sales cycle. Why does Superpipe focus on this specific window instead of long-term enterprise sales?

title: Virtual Assistant (Xero + Admin + UK Client)
description:
Are You a Bit… OCD?

If you love structure…

If you get genuine satisfaction from keeping things moving and making sure nothing slips…



Then this might be the perfect role for you.



I’m looking for a Virtual Assistant who is reliable, hungry to work, proactive, and able to think on their feet — not someone who needs micromanaging or waits for instructions.



Xero experience is essential (you don’t need to be an expert — just confident using it).



THE ROLE (15–20 hours/week)



Admin & Operations



Inbox management, follow-ups, tracking tasks, and keeping things organised



Updating sheets, dashboards, SOPs

Bookkeeping (must have experience)

Flagging discrepancies



AI / Tech



Using ChatGPT to summarise
s, organise info, build templates, create SOPs



Willing to learn simple AI tools 



UK Property experience is NOT required but helpful 



Task Flow

Some weeks will be busier, some quieter.

You’ll still be paid the agreed hours, but you must be okay with the rhythm changing.



REACTIVE TASKS (Non-negotiable)



You must be reachable during UK daytime hours for occasional urgent tasks.



This isn’t all day and doesn’t happen constantly — but when it does happen, it matters.



Examples:



Chasing a broker/agent



Approving something quickly



Resolving a simple issue



Checking a Xero transaction



You won’t be “on call” full-time — just reachable and responsive.



WHAT I’M LOOKING FOR



Hungry, reliable, and committed



Works independently without micromanagement

Handles deadlines without stress



Thinks ahead

REQUIREMENTS



Strong English

Comfortable using AI



Able to be responsive in UK daytime



OK with varied weekly workload

Property experience helpful but NOT necessary



How to Apply

title: Personal / Executive Assistant
description:
**Personal / Executive Assistant (Part-Time, Flexible Schedule)**



“If you can juggle tenants, tradesmen, and spreadsheets without losing your sense of humour, we need to talk.”*



---



About the Role



We’re looking for an **experienced, detail-driven Real Estate VA** based in the Philippines to help manage a UK property portfolio and handle light bookkeeping in **Xero**.



This isn’t traditional property management — you’ll act as the **middle person** between us and our letting/management agencies, making sure everything runs smoothly.



If a maintenance issue pops up, a refinance needs chasing, or a P&L doesn’t balance, you’ll be the one who notices and gets it sorted.



You’ll also help us develop and maintain **AI automations** that improve how we run the business, so being tech-curious (or eager to learn) is a big plus.



---



Hours & Flexibility



* Around **15 - 20 hours per week**, averaging **2–4 hours a day**

* Some days may be heavier or lighter depending on workload

*Must be available and responsive during UK business hours to monitor property updates, messages, and urgent alerts

*You’ll need to keep notifications on and stay reachable for emergencies — the workload is moderate, but reliability and responsiveness are key

*We’re paying above average because this role requires consistent awareness and ownership, even when you’re not actively working on tasks

* No night shifts — family-friendly schedule

* Long-term role with flexibility and trust at its core



---



Key Responsibilities



* Produce weekly/monthly P&L in Xero snapshots and flag anomalies

* Log and reconcile income/expenses in **Xero**

*
 management

* Monitor and liaise with letting agents & contractors daily

* Track mortgages, purchases, refinances, insurances and paperwork

* Manage light admin (follow-ups, reminders, payments)

* Maintain dashboards for property & finance metrics

* Some Personal assistant tasks 

*Assist with AI tool setup (ChatGPT, Make, Zapier, etc.)



---



You’re Right for This If You…



* Already know **Xero** and can manage data entry confidently

* Have experience with **property or real-estate admin**

* Communicate clearly in written & spoken English

* Are proactive, organised, and reliable

* Enjoy tech, learning, and improving systems

* Have a stable internet connection and quiet workspace



---



Pay & Benefits



* **$750–$900 USD per month** depending on experience and initiative

* Paid PH public holidays

* 13th-month pay (after 12 months, prorated first year)

* Long-term, flexible contract



---



How to Apply



Please apply only by clicking the “Apply” button here on OnlineJobs.ph.

Do not
 or message me outside the platform — all applications must stay within OnlineJobs.ph so we can review your profile and DISC test together.



When you apply, include in your message:



Please send a short **Loom or video intro (max 2 minutes)** answering:



1. What’s your experience with **Xero** and property admin?

2. How do you stay organised and proactive in remote work?

3. Have you used or explored **AI tools** like ChatGPT, Make, or Zapier?

4. What does your daily routine look like, and how would flexible hours suit you?



Use the subject line **“I’m your Property + PA / EA”** when applying so we know you’ve read this.

title: Part-Time HR Support (Recruitment Focus)
description:
We’re looking for a reliable Part-Time HR Support teammate whose main focus is recruitment and hiring support. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys sourcing great candidates, keeping hiring pipelines organized, and conducting strong first-round interviews. There’s clear growth potential into a larger HR role as you demonstrate impact and ownership.

What you’ll do (Core Responsibilities)

- Support end-to-end recruiting for multiple roles (creative, marketing, ops, admin, etc.)

- Post jobs, refresh listings, and manage incoming applications

- Source candidates via LinkedIn, job boards, and outreach

- Conduct initial screening calls and structured interviews

- Coordinate interview scheduling, follow-ups, and candidate communication

- Maintain clean, accurate hiring records (spreadsheets/ATS, notes, status updates)

- Prepare shortlists and candidate summaries for hiring managers

- Help improve recruiting workflows, templates, and interview processes over time



What success looks like

- Consistent flow of qualified candidates week to week

- Fast, professional candidate communication

- Strong interview notes and clear recommendations

- Hiring pipelines that are organized, updated, and easy to review





Requirements

- Experience in recruiting, HR support, or talent acquisition (freelance, agency, or in-house)

- Comfortable leading interviews and asking structured questions

- Strong written English and professional communication

- Organized, responsive, and able to manage multiple open roles at once

- Confident with Google Workspace (Sheets/Docs) and basic hiring trackers



Nice to have

- Experience recruiting remote contractors and distributed teams

- Basic HR admin knowledge (onboarding checklists, documentation, etc.)



Growth opportunity

This is a part-time role with room to expand based on performance. If you consistently deliver strong hires and improve our hiring process, this can grow into a bigger role with broader HR responsibilities.



Compensation

- Competitive hourly rate based on experience

- Long-term opportunity for consistent work and role expansion



How to apply

Send the following:

- A short intro (2–4 sentences) about your recruiting experience

- Your resume/CV

- A brief example of roles you’ve recruited for (and your approach)

- Your availability per week and preferred working hours/timezone

title: Real Estate Acquisitions Agent
description:
Mission Hill Capital Management (MHCM) is looking for a high-energy, disciplined Acquisitions Agent to join our "Deal Machine." This is a remote role designed for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, high-volume outbound calling environment.



The Role & Schedule

Hours: 20 hours per week.



Shift: Monday – Friday, 9:00 AM – 1:00 PM Eastern Standard Time (EST).



Focus: Turning unverified property data into verified leads through consistent outbound dialing and meticulous CRM management.



Key Responsibilities

High-Volume Outbound Calling: Execute a high volume of calls daily to property owners using our dialer.



Data Verification: Confirm property ownership and gauge initial interest/motivation.



CRM Hygiene: Accurately update lead status and follow-up tasks to ensure no deal falls through the cracks.



Lead Handoff: Identify "hot" leads and bridge them to the acquisitions team efficiently.



Compensation & Growth

Starting Base Pay: $4.00 per hour.



Performance Track: Clear path to increased hourly pay up to $6.50/hr and full-time hours based on lead quality and consistency.



Requirements

Proven experience with outbound cold calling (Real Estate experience preferred).



Familiarity with CRMs and automated dialers.



Excellent English communication skills with a professional phone presence.



A quiet, dedicated workspace with a reliable internet connection.



How to Apply:

To be considered, please provide the following:

- Resume: Submit your latest CV.

- Voice Recording: Include a brief introduction or mock cold call.

- Tool Experience: List the dialers and CRMs you have used.

- Social Media Check: 
 
 on Instagram (please include your handle in the application so we can verify).



Test Question to confirm you read this: What is the capital of Massachusetts?

title: Digital Growth & Optimization Specialist
description:
We are looking for a strategic Search & AI Visibility Manager to lead our transition from traditional SEO to the era of Generative Engine Optimization (GEO). Your mission is two-fold: drive high-quality backlinks that build our domain authority and ensure our brand is the "top-of-mind" recommendation for LLMs like ChatGPT, Claude, and Perplexity.



You aren't just chasing rankings; you are managing how the world—and the AI models that summarize it—perceives and cites our brand.



Key Responsibilities

1. High-Authority Backlink Strategy (Off-Page SEO)



Execute personalized outreach campaigns to secure placements on Tier-1 industry publications, news sites, and niche blogs.



Move beyond "spammy" tactics by building genuine relationships with editors and digital creators.



Conduct competitor gap analysis to identify missed opportunities for brand mentions and citations.



2. AI & LLM Optimization (GEO)



Optimize our digital footprint to ensure the brand is accurately "understood" and cited by AI models.



Monitor brand sentiment and "share of model" within AI-generated responses.



Work with the technical team to implement advanced 
 and JSON-LD structures that help LLMs parse our data more efficiently.



3. Content & Brand Integrity



Ensure all off-site content aligns with our brand voice and E-E-A-T (Experience, Expertise, Authoritativeness, and Trustworthiness) standards.



Audit "source-of-truth" platforms (Wikipedia, industry directories, Crunchbase) to ensure consistent data feeding into AI training sets.



Who You Are

The Strategic Connector: You know how to pitch a story that editors actually want to publish.



The AI Enthusiast: You aren't just using AI to write; you understand how LLMs crawl, process, and retrieve information.



Data-Driven: You are comfortable using tools like Ahrefs, Semrush, and Perplexity to track visibility and growth.



Technically Minded: You understand the basics of site architecture and how it influences crawler behavior.



Required Qualifications

3+ years in SEO, Digital PR, or Growth Marketing.



Proven track record of securing high-quality backlinks (be prepared to share examples).



Deep understanding of the evolving search landscape (SGE, Perplexity, etc.).



Exceptional writing and communication skills.

 into an “emotional engine” for VeeFriends—creating short, highly relatable posts that consistently perform in the 100K–200K+ reach range.

 posts (copy + simple, readable visuals)

nt

title: Accounting Operations Specialist
description:
Atlanta, Georgia Full-Time



Are you detail-driven, organized, and passionate about accounting accuracy? Do you thrive in a deadline-oriented environment where precision matters? We’re looking for an accounting operations specialist to join our growing finance team.



This role plays a critical part in managing accounts payable, petty cash, P-card transactions, and weekly reconciliations across multiple productions.



What You’ll Do

· Process vendor invoices and maintain accurate AP records

· Set up vendors and ensure W-9/tax compliance

· Manage petty cash accounts and advance requests

· Prepare and post journal entries

· Perform weekly P-card (Cashet) reconciliations

· Investigate discrepancies and resolve issues proactively

· Maintain organized, audit-ready financial documentation

· Communicate clearly with vendors, production staff, and leadership



What We’re Looking For

title: Do you love making people feel cared for? Support our CEOs as an Executive Personal Assistant!
description:
Title: Executive Personal Assistant



Important: Make sure to read the full listing for application instructions.



Do you love making people feel cared for? Are you the one who remembers everyone’s birthdays, plans amazing gatherings, makes fun plans, and brings warmth into the lives of those around you?



This is NOT your typical assistant job. It’s deeply personal. You’ll work with a kind but intense U.S.-based pair of brothers (proven entrepreneurs working as Co-CEOs of the same business) to support their lives, not the company they are building. From keeping friendships alive and planning meaningful experiences to sending thoughtful gifts and helping them stay on track with personal goals, you’ll be part organizer, part cheerleader, part coach. If you’ve ever been called the “mom” of your group and you’re looking for a decades-long position, this might be your dream job.



Your Role

* Build trust by executing on tasks and communicating clearly, which will lead to taking on more responsibility, which will then lead to increases in pay.

* Keep relationships thriving by managing a personal CRM and helping stay in touch with friends and family.

* Use technology to help automate certain tasks that are repetitive.

* Track habits, support routines, and act as an accountability partner for personal goals.

* Pick out thoughtful, creative gifts for birthdays and other special 
nts.

* Research products, tools, and ideas to make life easier, better, or more fun.

* Plan and book unforgettable travel, great hotels, and the perfect dinner spots.

* Jump in on special personal projects wherever a helping hand is needed.



What’s In It for You

* A Long-Term Role: This is meant to last. The entrepreneurs who you'd be an assistant to are looking for a lifetime assistant.

* Great Place to Work: These entrepreneurs are known to have a super high retention rate of employees and create a great work environment.

* Creative Work: From planning memorable trips to picking out the perfect gift, this role lets you flex your creative muscles and thoughtful side every day.

* Variety: No two days will feel the same. You’ll get to research, plan, coach, organize, and more.

* Paid Leave: You'll get at least 10 days of paid leave plus major holidays.

* Remote Flexibility: Work from the comfort of your home and gain flexibility with hours once trust is built.



Desired Attributes

* Extremely caring, social people-person who will excel in personal tasks

* High attention to detail and organizational skills

* Very strong written and oral English skills

* Minimum 50 Mbps Internet Speed

* Designated office space in your home



To apply and ensure your application is considered, do all of the following two steps:

1. DM with a quick introduction to yourself if you're interested. Include the word "cupcake" *in your subject line*, and Include your resume. ++Bonus points for a video introduction, though it's not strictly required

2. Fill out this form:

3.  Add the Letters "PA" in the "What's your full name" field [E.g. PA - John Doe], so we know what role you are applying for.

title: executive assistant
description:
VA posting & assessment questions” 





LINK FOR SCREENING INTERVIEW RESPONSES:  





VIRTUAL ASSISTANT – SALES AND MARKETING SUPPORT



Part-Time, Growing Role

Location

Philippines (Remote)

Hours

Start at 10hours per week, with opportunity to grow to 20 hours and maybe more based on performance and business needs.

Compensation

Hourly compensation with performance-based incentives for sales that result in closed business.



Long-Term Opportunity

Yes. This role is intended to grow into a long-term working relationship.

________________________________________

ABOUT THE ROLE



We are seeking a highly reliable, detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to support sales outreach, client communication, and marketing workflows. This role begins part-time and is intentionally designed to grow as trust, skills, and results are demonstrated.

The Virtual Assistant will work directly with the business owner and will be entrusted with access to core systems, including a CRM,
 marketing platform, and shared Gmail account. A high level of integrity, discretion, and accountability is essential.

________________________________________

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



Sales and Outreach Support

• Make cold and warm outbound calls to prospects using provided scripts and talking points

• Make follow-up and relationship calls to existing clients

• Track calls, notes, outcomes, and next steps accurately in the CRM and/or spreadsheets

• Support follow-up workflows that lead to appointments and closed sales

Marketing and
 Support

• Draft and send
 newsletters and
 blasts

• Experience with Constant Contact is preferred

• Organize, clean, and segment contact lists

• Maintain consistent branding, tone, and professionalism in all written communications

Systems and Workflow Management

• Update and manage CRM records accurately and consistently

• Maintain organized contact lists and call logs

• Follow clearly defined workflows and contribute to improving them over time

• Communicate progress, challenges, and results clearly and professionally

Bonus Skills (Preferred but Not Required)

• Light graphic design using Canva or similar tools

• Familiarity with marketing campaigns or funnels

• Experience supporting small business owners, publishers, or event-based organizations

________________________________________

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

• Excellent spoken and written English

• Comfortable making outbound phone calls

• Prior experience using CRM systems and
 marketing platforms

• Strong attention to detail and follow-through

• High level of trustworthiness and respect for confidentiality

• Ability to work independently, manage time effectively, and meet deadlines

• Reliable internet connection and a quiet, professional calling environment

________________________________________

WHAT WE OFFER

• A respectful and professional working relationship

• Clear expectations, processes, and workflows

• Opportunity to grow hours and responsibilities over time

• Performance incentives tied to successful sales outcomes

• Long-term collaboration for the right candidate

________________________________________

APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS

Applicants must answer the screening questions below thoroughly.

Short or generic responses will not be considered.

________________________________________

SCREENING AND INTERVIEW QUESTIONS

1. Sales and Calling Experience

• Please describe your experience making cold and warm outbound calls.

• What types of businesses or services were you calling for?

• Approximately how many calls did you make per day or per week?

2. Handling Rejection and Follow-Up

• How do you typically respond when a prospect is not interested?

• How do you handle a prospect who says, “Call me later”?

• Please explain your approach.

3. CRM and Systems Experience

• Which CRM and
 marketing platforms have you used?

• What tasks did you handle inside the CRM?

• How did you ensure accuracy and organization?

4.
 and Written Communication

• Please write a short sample follow-up
 to a prospect who received information about a business service but has not yet responded.

• This writing sample is required and will be reviewed carefully.

5. Trust and Confidentiality

• How do you ensure confidentiality and data security in your work?

• Have you previously worked in a role that required a high level of trust? Please explain.

6. Time Management and Accountability

• If you are given 10 hours per week, how do you plan and track your work to ensure productivity and results?

7. Performance Incentives

• This role includes bonuses for outreach that leads to closed sales.

• What motivates you more: hourly work, performance incentives, or a combination of both?

• Please explain why.

8. Growth and Commitment

• This role is designed to grow from 10 hours to 20 hours and potentially more per week.

• Are you comfortable with a gradual increase in hours?

• Are you seeking a long-term role?

9. Bonus Skills

• Please list any experience you have with graphic design tools such as Canva.

• Please describe any experience with marketing campaigns or newsletters.

• Please note any experience related to publishing, media, or event promotion.

title: Graphic Designer/Social Media Manager
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION: 



We are seeking an experienced graphic designer/social media manager with sophisticated taste, exceptional communication skills, and deep knowledge of building a social media following.



We are a premium law + mediation firm launching next month.  We have brand guidelines, a brand voice, photo assets, a polished website, and several newsletters already finalized for launch.



Our audience is educated parents (ages 35–50) navigating divorce.



We have a vision for our social media presence, but we need someone with high level technical skill, efficient and proactive work habits, and deep knowledge of how to do everything from designing a one-sheeter to setting up a newsletter distribution system to creating tasteful, minimal instagram content.  We want to work with someone who has smart recommendations and has done all of this before.



We'd like this professional relationship to continue hopefully for several years.



Scope of Work



We are starting a business and starting our social media presence.  We need A LOT of help creating client-facing one-sheeters, presentations, and brand assets.



We need you to create a social media launch strategy.  What would be the fastest growing channels?  What would be the best approach given we don't have a lot of time to create content?  Etc.



Initial Setup (one-time)

Create and/or fully set up:

Instagram business account

Google Business Account

LinkedIn business page

Newsletter platform (Mailchimp / ConvertKit / Flodesk / Substack — your recommendation)

Possible Youtube

*Open to your suggestions



Set up a clean content system:

Canva templates (IG posts, quote graphics, YouTube thumbnails)

Shared folder structure

Simple content calendar



Requirements

Graphic design training

Proven experience repurposing long-form video into short-form clips

Portfolio examples required

Strong editorial judgment and professionalism

Comfortable working closely and collaboratively with client 

Experience with professional services brands

Experience launching social media accounts



Time & Budget

• Ongoing: 5-10 hours/week

• Setup: 30-40 hours total

• We require detailed invoices breaking down hourly charges



INTERVIEW PROCESS:



Our company is doing something completely original in the divorce space. We're hoping to find a social media manager/graphic designer who really understands our vision and brand and could hopefully work with us consistently long-term. To make sure we find the right long-term fit, our interview process involves creating sample work for us.  We pay for your time.



It's very similar work to what your job would be. You'll receive access to a folder that has all of the background you need to get a basic understanding of the company and some raw materials (newsletter and videos) to turn into social posts.

 Outreach).

title: Experienced Tutor  for 3rd Grade Students – U.S. Curriculum)
description:
To Apply: fill this application form and schedule interview 







Please Submit a 3–5 Minute Loom Video in the application form Answering the Following:



1?? Math Explanation

Explain step-by-step how you would teach a struggling 3rd grader to solve:



36 ÷ 4



Assume the child does not understand division at all.

Teach it as if you are speaking directly to the child.



2?? English Correction

Correct this sentence and explain how you would teach the concept:



“She goed to the store and buyed candy.”



What errors do you see?

How would you help the child understand the correction?



3?? Confidence Question

If a child says,



“I’m bad at math. I hate math.”



What would you say and how would you handle it?

Also include :

Your experience teaching US elementary students

Your experience with intervention/remediation

Your availability (US EST time zone)



Important:



Applications without a Loom video will not be considered.



This short teaching sample helps ensure we don’t waste each other’s time and allows me to identify a teacher who can truly support intervention, not just assignment completion.





I am seeking an experienced elementary intervention teacher for my 3rd-grade child who is currently struggling in Math and English under US academic standards.



My child is enrolled in Georgia Connections Academy (GACA), so this role requires someone who can:



Support daily/weekly online coursework



Ensure full understanding of concepts



Prepare for quizzes and tests



Close academic gaps through structured intervention



Build confidence in struggling areas



This is NOT a homework-completion role.

I am looking for someone with real experience in  academic intervention assistance. The curriculum and resources are already available on the school platform, so you would not have to create a curriculum, just follow the school resources as teaching tools.



Responsibilities:



Conduct live 1:1 Zoom sessions (3–4 times per week)



Review and support GACA assignments



Help student with GACA structured weekly intervention plan



Identify learning gaps



Provide short weekly progress updates



Track measurable improvement



Ideal Candidate:



Degree in Education (preferred)



Experience teaching US elementary students



Experience with struggling learners or intervention



Strong understanding of US curriculum standards



Clear communication and patient teaching style



Organized and structured



Bonus: Experience supporting students in online school platforms.

title: Home Health RN Care Manager with Texas License
