Halcyon Home, LLC is seeking a Remote Home Health RN Remote Care Manager to play a crucial role in ensuring the seamless coordination and efficiency of home health care services.



The Home Health RN Remote Care Manager is responsible for coordinating, managing, and overseeing administrative and care management operations for a home health agency in a remote setting. This role ensures efficient workflow, regulatory compliance, effective communication between clinical staff and patients, and accurate documentation and billing support.



About Us:

Halcyon Home is a fast-growing, central Texas-owned home health, hospice, and home care company. We emphasize hospitality and compassion to encourage positive patient outcomes for our refined, aging clients. We were voted Best in Home Health/Hospice four years running and Best in Home Care three years running by the Senior Resource Guide. We are also one of the Great Places to Work! Come join our team! Here is our website: 



Key responsibilities:

• Responsible for conducting an ongoing auditing of clinical documentation comprehensive, integrated agency assessment of the quality and appropriateness of the care provided, including services provided under arrangement.

• Aggregate and trend data collected to correct identified problems in collaboration with management.

• Monitor all service providers for effective interchange and coordination of care in providing care.

• Ensure timely submission of documentation, orders, and certifications.

• Ensure compliance with state, federal, and Medicare/Medicaid regulations.

• Communicate effectively with interdisciplinary tea
mbers.

• Participate in daily care coordination meetings.

• Monitor documentation for accuracy, timeliness, and completeness.

• Assist with record audits and quality improvement initiatives.

• Maintain HIPAA compliance and data security standards.



Qualifications:

• Experience in home health and case management required

• Strong knowledge of home health regulations and workflows

• Proficiency with HCHB EMR/EHR systems and Microsoft Office

• Excellent organizational, time management, and communication skills

• Ability to work independently in a remote environment

• OASIS and 485 plan of care review experience required.

• Prior remote or virtual healthcare management experience



Skills & Competencies:

• Attention to detail

• Multitasking and problem-solving

• Strong interpersonal and customer service skills

• Leadership and team coordination

• Confidentiality and professionalism



Work Environment:

description:

About Us

We’re an Australian mortgage broking business growing to the next level. We already have strong referrals/repeat business and want to increase organic inbound leads and paid lead flow while building a marketing system that can scale (and eventually feed additional brokers).

Role Objective



Own day-to-day marketing execution and improvement across:



- Social content creation + posting

- Paid ads (Meta + Google)

- SEO + organic lead growth

- Weekly reporting and optimisation



This is a hands-on role. You will plan, create, publish, measure, and improve.

Key Responsibilities



1) Content creation + social media management

Build a weekly content plan and posting schedule

Turn raw footage (we will be on camera) into:

short-form videos (Reels/Shorts/TikTok style)

carousels/static posts

story content

Write captions, hooks, CTAs, and manage basic community engagement

Repurpose content across platforms for maximum output



2) Paid advertising (Meta + Google)

Build and manage campaigns end-to-end:

targeting, creatives, copy, landing page brief, conversion tracking

optimisation, A/B testing, and budget pacing

Produce weekly performance updates:

spend, CPL, cost per booked call (where tracking allows), lead quality notes

Ensure all ad accounts are owned by us (you work inside our accounts)



3) SEO + organic growth

Improve local SEO and organic lead flow:

on-page SEO (service pages, location pages, internal links, metadata)

Google Business Profile activity (posts, Q&A, photos, review velocity process)

basic technical SEO checks (indexing, Search Console issues)

Coordinate blog/topic plan that supports organic discovery and conversion



4) Tracking, reporting, and optimisation

Set up/maintain tracking (GA4, Tag Manager basics, pixels, conversion events)

Weekly KPI dashboard and action plan:

leads, booked calls (if applicable), conversion rate, channel performance

Recommend what to scale, what to stop, and what to test next



Please show me that you are genuinely interested in this opportunity with a cover letter not prepared by AI.

At CloseAbility, we believe top performers deserve to be rewarded without limits. If you’re motivated, competitive, and eager to grow, this is your chance to build a high-earning career in real estate sales while working fully remote.

We’re a fast-growing real estate platform helping licensed agents get more clients and close more deals. To keep up with demand, we’re expanding our outbound sales team and looking for driven Business Development Representatives (BDRs) to connect with agents and enroll them onto our platform.



Why Join CloseAbility?



- Commission-first opportunity – designed for people who want to earn more than what a standard hourly job can offer

- Uncapped income potential – your performance directly drives your paycheck

- Weekly pay – $200 draw against commissions plus bonuses

- Proven system & full support – leads, scripts, software, and coaching to help you succeed quickly

- Growth culture – improve your close rate and scale your income with ongoing mentorship and training



What You’ll Do

- Call licensed real estate agents using a power dialer (leads provided)

- Use a simple, proven script to enroll agents or book them into meetings

- Track activity in our CRM and follow up with interested agents

- Work toward weekly performance benchmarks and continuously improve with coaching



What We Provide

- Pre-sourced, licensed leads (no cold prospecting required)

- CRM access, phone software, and ready-to-use scripts

- Structured training, mentorship, and performance coaching

- A collaborative and supportive team culture that celebrates wins and growth



Who Thrives in This Role

- People who are excited to trade a small base for bigger commission potential

- Sales professionals with Real Estate SaaS or real estate coaching experience (preferred)

- Competitive, self-driven individuals who want control over their income

- Outbound sales reps, recruiters, or appointment setters who enjoy phone-based work

- Communicators who follow proven processes, adapt quickly, and aim high

- Candidates from the Philippines are strongly encouraged to apply



Important to Know

This role is best suited for people who are comfortable with performance-based earnings. The base draw is provided for consistency, but real income comes from commissions and bonuses. If you prefer a high guaranteed hourly rate or do not enjoy consistent phone outreach, this may not be the best fit.



How to Apply

Send us:

- Your name and contact info

- A short introduction (1–2 sentences on why you’re a fit)

- Your resume (required)





We’re hiring immediately. If you’re ready for a full-time remote role with no income ceiling, strong support, and real career growth potential, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Sales Development Representative
description:
Sales Development Representative 



Location: Remote 

Job Type: Full-Time / Part-Time

About CloseAbility

CloseAbility is a SaaS company revolutionizing how real estate and legal professionals manage distressed property transactions. Our platform streamlines complex workflows, enabling professionals to close deals more efficiently and effectively.



At CloseAbility, we are proud of our strong Filipino roots—3 out of our 4 founders are Filipinos. This reflects our deep appreciation for Filipino talent, and we strive to build a workplace that values collaboration, innovation, and professional growth.



Role Overview



We are seeking a highly motivated and ambitious individual for an entry-level Sales Development Representative (SDR) position. Whether you’re a fresh graduate or someone looking to change careers, this is the perfect opportunity to break into the high-income potential world of tech sales. As an SDR, you will be instrumental in building the foundation of our sales pipeline and helping us expand our customer base. This role offers the unique opportunity to progress within the company, with the potential to advance to an Account Executive role in Tech Sales in just 1 to 4 years—where Account Executives at CloseAbility can earn a six-figure salary.



Responsibilities



Lead Generation: Identify and prospect potential clients through cold calls,
s, social media, and networking.

Qualify Leads: Engage with leads to understand their needs, qualify them, and move them through the sales funnel.

Relationship Building: Establish strong relationships with key decision-makers in target companies.

Collaborate with Sales Team: Pass along qualified leads to Account Executives and support them in follow-up communication.

CRM Management: Maintain detailed records of interactions with prospects in CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot).

Sales Metrics: Achieve targets related to calls made, meetings booked, and opportunities created.

Market Research: Stay updated on industry trends and competitors to uncover new sales opportunities.

Continuous Improvement: Participate in ongoing sales training to improve your skills and sales effectiveness.



Qualifications



Associate’s or Bachelor’s Degree (required).

No prior experience required.

Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to engage prospects.

A self-starter attitude with a goal-oriented approach.

Ability to manage rejection and stay persistent in a fast-paced environment.

Proficiency in Excel/Spreadsheets for tracking and reporting.

Familiarity with CRM systems (Go High Level, Salesforce, etc.) and phone systems for sales outreach.

Self-motivated, able to work independently while contributing to a remote team.



Why Join CloseAbility?



Gain the potential to progress to a six-figure Account Executive role within 1 to 4 years.

Work in a fast-growing SaaS company in the real estate industry.

Be part of a Filipino-friendly workplace—3 out of 4 founders are Filipino!

Flexible working hours, as long as deadlines are met.

Opportunities for career advancement and professional growth.

Collaborative and supportive remote work culture.

Paid training to ensure you are fully equipped for success in your role.

 — we will primarily review applicants from this source.

, WhatsApp, or any other direct communication channels regarding this job posting. All applications must be submitted through the designated platform.

title: Hiring & HR Operations Manager (Systems-Driven, High-Accountability Role)
description:
???? About Dash Holdings

Dash Holdings is a systems-driven, Black-owned company operating in private rentals, automation, and digital asset-building.

We are building a franchise-grade operation that runs without the owner.

We move fast.

We follow SOPs.

We protect culture.

We reward discipline.

If you are looking for a relaxed, low-accountability job — this is not for you.

If you want to help build a real machine — keep reading.

???? ROLE PURPOSE

You are responsible for protecting the company through disciplined hiring and structured HR oversight.

Your job is to:

• Find the right Who’s

• Eliminate weak applicants early

• Test for SOP compliance

• Run structured interviews

• Enforce probation standards

• Track performance + documentation

• Protect leadership time

This is not a creative role.

This is a discipline role.

???? CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

Hiring Execution

• Post job listings (OnlineJobs, Indeed,
, etc.)

• Create and manage hidden instruction filters

• Screen resumes + test submissions

• Run structured interviews (script provided)

• Score candidates using internal scorecards

• Recommend hire / reject decisions

HR Operations

• Track attendance + task completion

• Monitor probation periods (14–30 days)

• Issue warnings (one warning max)

• Coordinate onboarding access

• Remove access immediately upon termination

• Maintain employee files

Systems Protection

• Ensure every hire understands SOP compliance

• Ensure every hire understands culture standards

• Ensure every hire understands reporting structure

You do NOT:

• Set pay structures

• Change company vision

• Override SOPs

???? WORK SCHEDULE

• 30–40 hours per week

• Must overlap minimum 3 hours EST daily

• Must provide daily written updates

???? PAY STRUCTURE

Training Period (2–4 weeks):

$200–$250 bi-weekly

Post-Training:

$400–$600+ bi-weekly based on performance and speed

Performance raises available every 90 days.

Pay increases are tied to:

• Hiring quality

• Low turnover

• Compliance rates

• Speed

???? IDEAL CANDIDATE PROFILE

You:

• Have prior HR or hiring experience

• Are comfortable rejecting people

• Are emotionally neutral in conflict

• Understand high-accountability environments

• Move fast without supervision

• Follow written instructions exactly

You are not:

• Sensitive to direct leadership

• Easily overwhelmed

• Slow with systems

• Resistant to structure

???? ATTENTION TEST (Hidden Instruction)

To be considered, include this phrase in your subject line:

“System First, Emotion Second.”

Failure to include this = automatic rejection.

???? GROWTH PATH

This role can evolve into:

Director of People & Culture

VP of Talent & Operations

But only if:

• You prove discipline first

• You protect the system

• You reduce turnover

We promote from within.

???? FINAL NOTE

This is not a corporate job.

This is a growth environment.

If you want:

• Structure

• Clarity

• Discipline

• Long-term opportunity

Apply.

If you want comfort and low pressure —

this is not your lane.

We are a fast-growing digital education company that helps entrepreneurs create and sell digital products. We host live trainings and sell an all-in-one Digital Products Creators Sales & Marketing System.



We are NOT looking for someone who “likes sales.”

We are looking for someone who lives and breathes closing.



Your Role: You will be responsible for calling warm leads daily from paid ads and a free training we conducted to:



* Sell tickets to our Digital Product Creators Mentorship Training

* Close sales for our Digital Product Creators Sales & Marketing System

* Follow up with prospects consistently

* Overcome objections confidently

* Hit daily call and revenue targets



You will be on the phone ALL DAY. This is a performance-driven role.



Daily Requirements



* Minimum 75-100 outbound calls per day

* Consistent follow-up via phone & SMS

* Daily reporting of:



Calls made

Conversations

Sales closed

Revenue generated

Comfortable handling objections and pushing for the close



Who We’re Looking For



You MUST have:



* Minimum **2+ years of phone sales experience**

* Strong closing skills

* Aggressive, confident, and results-driven personality

* Thick skin (you will hear “no” often)

* Ability to build urgency and create excitement

* High energy and professional tone on calls

* Reliable internet and quiet workspace



This is NOT for beginners.

This is for closers who want to win.



Compensation



* Competitive base pay

* Commission on every sale

* Performance bonuses for hitting targets

* High income potential for top performers



If you cannot handle rejection, high call volume, or aggressive targets — this role is not for you.



???? To Apply



Send:



1. A short video (2–3 minutes) introducing yourself and why you will be the perfect canidate for this position

2. Your sales experience (include metrics if possible)

3. Your average daily call volume in past roles

4. Why you believe you are a closer and not just a salesperson



Only serious closers apply.

title: Operations & Recruiting Assistant
description:
About Us

Using AI to Scale is a fast-growing company that helps businesses leverage artificial intelligence and automation to scale their operations. We build AI-powered tools, recruit top talent, and deploy cutting-edge technology for our clients. Our flagship products include SpeakerAgent.AI (an AI SaaS platform) and custom CRM & automation solutions for the insurance industry.

We move fast, we build constantly, and AI does the heavy lifting. We need someone who can keep up.





The Role

We're hiring an Operations & Recruiting Assistant to be the backbone of our day-to-day operations. You'll manage our entire recruiting pipeline, keep our project management systems organized, run our social media presence, and maintain our candidate database. AI tools handle most of the heavy lifting, but we need a sharp, tech-savvy person making sure everything runs smoothly and nothing falls through the cracks.

This is not a sit-and-wait kind of job. You'll be actively sourcing candidates, conducting interviews, managing our ClickUp workspace, posting on social media, and learning new AI tools as we roll them out. If you love staying busy, learning fast, and being part of something that's growing quickly, this is your role.





What You'll Do

Recruiting & Candidate Management

Manage the full recruiting pipeline from sourcing to interview scheduling to follow-up

Source and find new candidates on job boards, LinkedIn,
 groups, and other channels

Conduct first-round screening interviews following our structured interview process

Track every candidate in our database — status, notes, assessment submissions, interview results

Send follow-up
s, reminders, and assessment instructions to candidates

Categorize and document all recruiting activity so nothing gets lost

Project Management (ClickUp)

Manage and organize tasks, projects, and workflows in ClickUp

Keep boards updated with task statuses, deadlines, and assignees

Create and maintain standard operating procedures (SOPs) for recurring processes

Flag blockers, overdue items, and anything that needs attention

Social Media & Newsletter

Manage our
 and 
pany pages

Post job openings, company updates, and recruiting content regularly

Engage with comments and messages from potential candidates

Help manage and send our recruiting newsletter to keep candidates warm

AI & Technology

Learn and use AI tools we deploy (Claude Code, Claude Desktop, automation platforms)

Help test, document, and improve our AI-powered workflows

Use AI assistants to draft content, process data, and speed up repetitive tasks

Stay curious — we’ll teach you new tools constantly and expect you to pick them up fast





Who You Are

Tech-savvy and a fast learner — You don't need to know every tool we use, but you need to be able to learn them quickly. If you've never used ClickUp or Claude Code before, that's fine. If the idea of learning them excites you, even better.

Organized and detail-oriented — You keep track of everything. Candidates don't fall through the cracks on your watch. Tasks get updated. Nothing is left half-done.

Experienced in recruiting — You've done recruiting before, whether it's sourcing, screening, interviewing, or managing a pipeline. Bonus if you've recruited for tech or remote roles.

Comfortable with social media — You can write a solid 
 or
 post, engage with comments, and help build our online presence.

Strong communicator — Clear, professional English (written and spoken). You'll be conducting interviews and sending candidate communications daily.

Self-starter — You don't wait to be told what to do. You see something that needs to happen and you make it happen.





Nice to Have (Not Required)

Experience with ClickUp or similar project management tools (Asana, Monday, Trello)

Experience with AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, automation platforms like 
 or n8n)

Experience managing newsletters (Mailchimp, ConvertKit, etc.)

Background in tech recruiting or working with remote teams

Familiarity with OnlineJobs.ph, LinkedIn Recruiter, or other sourcing platforms





Compensation & Growth

Starting rate: $5/hr USD (full-time, 40 hours/week)

Performance-based raises — We reward results. Show us what you can do and your rate grows with the company.

Learn cutting-edge AI tools — You'll get hands-on training with tools most people haven't even heard of yet. This experience alone is a career accelerator.

Ground-floor opportunity — We're growing fast. The right person in this role will grow into a leadership position as we scale.





How to Apply

Send your application to 
 with the subject line:

"Operations Assistant Application — [Your Name]"

Include your resume, a brief intro about yourself, and why you're a fit for this role. We'll respond with next steps including a short technical assessment.

We're hiring immediately. Apply today.

title: Au Intermediate/ Senior Tax Accountant

Key Responsibilities

• Preparation of financial statements and income tax returns for:

       o Trusts

• General accounting and compliance work as directed by the Principal

• Working to Australian tax deadlines with accuracy and efficiency



SMSF experience is highly regarded but not essential.

________________________________________

Mandatory Requirements



? Minimum 3 years’ experience in Australian public practice

HandiSoft experience is highly regarded.

________________________________________

Why Join Us

To Apply

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: SEO Production Assistant (WordPress + Content + SearchAtlas)
description:
About Us

We are Results Digital, a U.S.-based marketing agency specializing in SEO and lead generation for service-based businesses (roofing, restoration, contractors, etc.).



Our SEO department is growing, and we are hiring an SEO Production Assistant to support our SEO Lead with structured, execution-focused tasks.

This is an implementation role.



If you are organized, detail-oriented, and good at following processes exactly, you’ll do very well here.



What You’ll Be Doing

-Writing and publishing press releases (EIN Presswire, King Newswire, SearchAtlas Auto)

-Modifying AI-generated blog articles (images, formatting, internal links)

-Creating and duplicating local/service pages in WordPress

-Setting meta titles and descriptions

-Submitting guest post URL + keyword sheets

-Organizing SEO assets and documentation

-Entering indexing requests inside SearchAtlas



You will be following structured SOPs and checklists.



Required Skills

? WordPress experience (creating pages, duplicating pages, formatting content)

? Comfortable using ChatGPT for structured content generation

? Basic understanding of internal linking

? Strong attention to detail

? Good written English

? Ability to follow checklists precisely

? Comfortable with repetitive weekly tasks



Nice to Have

-Basic SEO knowledge

-Experience with press release platforms

-Familiarity with SearchAtlas

-Agency experience



Work Hours

-10–20 hours per week to start

Compensation

$5–$8 per hour depending on experience.

Higher pay available for candidates who demonstrate strong WordPress + SEO execution skills during trial.



Accountability

We operate with:

-Task checklists

-Time tracking

-Measurable output expectations



If you prefer vague tasks and loose structure, this role is not for you.

This role will require excellent communication skills, attention to detail, and a commitment to continuous learning.

Measurable: Client satisfaction will be measured through monthly feedback surveys, aiming for at least an 85% satisfaction rate.

Achievable: The VA will complete at least one relevant training session per quarter to improve communication and problem-solving skills.

Relevant: The VA will contribute to both client retention and internal team efficiency, improving overall operations by ensuring smooth information flow.

Time-Bound: Within the first 60 days, the VA will independently manage at least 90% of client communications and provide weekly reports on client interactions and team communication effectiveness.

Monthly tea
etings for overall performance and alignment.

title: Video & Graphics Editor
description:
We are a U.S.-based contractor education and consulting company focused on construction business owners building structured, profitable businesses.



Our brand is built on long-term authority, grounded in consistency, clarity, and disciplined positioning.

We do not chase trends or short-term attention.



We value:

? Consistency

? Credibility

? Clarity

? Structured systems

? Long-term positioning



We build serious educational content for serious contractors.



About the Role

The Video & Graphics Editor is responsible for executing high-quality visual content that reflects the authority of our brand.

This is not a fast-content, viral-style editing role.

This role supports long-form YouTube authority content first, then repurposes it strategically into short-form pieces.

You will work closely with the Content Strategy Manager to ensure:

? Messaging is clear

? Visuals are clean and professional

? Branding is consistent

? Editing enhances authority — not distracts from it

We prioritize clarity over flash.

Platform Focus

Primary Platform: YouTube (Long-Form Authority Content)

Supporting Platforms:

?

? Instagram

? TikTok

Long-form builds authority.

 Short-form supports positioning.

Core Responsibilities

Video Editing

? Edit long-form YouTube videos (education-focused)

? Create short-form cuts from long-form videos

? Add clean lower thirds, minimal motion graphics, and structured transitions

? Enhance clarity (zoom-ins, callouts, emphasis where needed)

? Maintain consistent pacing aligned with authority tone

? Apply branding guidelines consistently



Graphics & Thumbnails

? Design YouTube thumbnails aligned with authority positioning

? Create promotional graphics for ads and social platforms

? Maintain visual consistency (fonts, spacing, layout, tone)

? Avoid clickbait styling



Repurposing

? Convert long-form content into platform-appropriate short-form videos

? Format content correctly for each platform

? Optimize for clarity and readability

Tools

We currently use:

? Descript

? Opus Pro

? Other professional video editing software

You may recommend additional tools or software that improve quality and workflow efficiency.

We are open to better systems — if they elevate the work.

What We Value

? Authority over virality

? Clean editing over over-stimulation

? Structure over chaos

? Professional visuals over trendy effects

? Long-term brand equity over short-term spikes

Qualifications

You must:

? Have proven experience editing long-form YouTube videos

? Have experience creating professional thumbnails

? Understand pacing for educational content

? Be comfortable editing talking-head style videos

? Understand how visuals impact authority positioning

? Communicate clearly in English

? Take structured feedback professionally

? Work independently and meet deadlines

Preferred:

? Experience working with education brands

? Experience with Descript and Opus Pro

? Experience creating short-form clips from long-form videos

? Understanding of YouTube formatting best practices

Work Structure

Full-Time (40 hours/week)

 8:30 AM – 5:30 PM EST

 Long-term opportunity

Compensation is based on experience and portfolio quality.

Final Note

We are building a long-term authority brand in the contractor education space.

If you are looking to create flashy, viral content, this is not the right role.

If you understand clean, strategic, authority-driven content, we would like to hear from you.

description:
This is a full-time remote role Focused on:



• Viral content research?• YouTube growth support?• Multi-platform distribution?• Project tracking & workflow oversight?• Final video review support?• Patreon & content organization?• Analytics monitoring

This role directly impacts content quality, retention, and growth.

We are not looking for a basic virtual assistant.?We are looking for someone who thinks strategically and adds value immediately.



???? About Us

Social Symone Studios is a fast-growing finance-focused YouTube media brand with over 260,000 subscribers and millions of monthly views. We create engaging, high-retention, emotionally intelligent commentary content centered around money, consumer behavior, debt, and viral financial conversations in the United States.

We are building a real digital media company — not just a YouTube channel.

We are looking for a highly organized, proactive, strategic thinker to serve as the right-hand support in content growth and operations. Please see link here for YouTube channel. 





???? Core Responsibilities

1?? Viral Content Research (Daily)

• Identify trending U.S.-based finance and consumer topics?• Monitor TikTok, YouTube, Reddit, and news for viral financial conversations?• Deliver multiple reaction-ready content options daily?• Provide strategic breakdown for each idea:

* Target audience

* Core problem

* Emotional angle

* Why it will perform

* Value to the viewer

Must understand U.S. consumer trends and cultural context.



2?? Content Pipeline & Project Tracking

• Track all active videos in production?• Maintain organized spreadsheets?• Monitor editing progress?• Track upload schedule?• Ensure at least one long-form video is always ready?• Keep leadership informed on status

Must be highly organized and skilled in Google Sheets / Excel.



3?? Video Review & Quality Control

• Review final edits in 
?• Check for:

* Missed profanity censorship

* Filter failures

* Audio issues

* Political commentary removal

* Retention pacing?• Provide structured revision notes

Strong English comprehension required.



4?? Multi-Platform Distribution

• Repurpose long-form content into Shorts/Reels?• Post and optimize content across:

* YouTube Shorts

* TikTok

* Instagram Reels

* Other platforms as needed?• Track performance per platform



5?? Growth & Analytics Support

• Monitor CTR, retention, RPM?• Use tools like VidIQ?• Analyze competitor videos?• Suggest optimization improvements?• Provide weekly performance summaries



6?? Patreon & Secondary Channel Support

• Help organize Patreon content?• Assist in posting and managing tiers?• Oversee secondary YouTube channel workflow?• Help identify monetization opportunities



???? What We’re Looking For

You must:

• Be fluent in English (written and spoken)?• Understand U.S. internet culture and trends?• Be highly organized and proactive?• Be comfortable using:

* TikTok

* YouTube Studio

* Google Drive

* Google Sheets

* 

* VidIQ

* ChatGPT?• Have strong initiative?• Be comfortable working independently?• Be detail-oriented?• Be growth-minded

You should think like an owner, not an employee.



???? Compensation

• $1,100 USD per month?• Full-time remote position?• 90-day evaluation period?• Room for growth and compensation increase based on performance

We value long-term tea
mbers and offer opportunity for advancement as the company scales.



???? Why Join Us?

• Be part of a rapidly growing digital media brand?• High impact role?• Direct collaboration with leadership?• Opportunity to grow with the company?• Performance-based growth potential



???? Application Process

To apply, please submit:

1. Resume

2. Brief explanation of why you’re a strong fit (in message)

3. 3–5 U.S.-based viral finance-related topics you believe would perform well on YouTube (include breakdown of audience, angle, and why this video is helpful or entertaining to my audience.) with provided TikTok clips as links to to evaluate your ability to find the best topics and video display creativity. Also include what tools you use to come to the conclusion that this would be a great video for my channel. 

4. After doing your research, who in the YouTube commentary space do you think you is a competitor for my YouTube channel to get video inspiration for my channel? Link their channels below please provide your top 3. You MUST PROVIDE THREE.



ALL APPLICANTS Must be open for interview through Zoom if you make it to final round of interviews.

(if FULL instructions of this application are not followed you will be disqualified from the application process)

title: Google Ads Specialist (Performance-Focused)
description:
We are Results Digital, a fast-growing digital marketing agency serving service-based businesses in the U.S. (roofing, restoration, contractors, home services, etc.).



We are looking for a detail-oriented, data-driven Google Ads Specialist who cares deeply about performance, optimization, and continuous improvement.



This is not a “set it and forget it” role.

This is a hands-on, daily optimization role.



Your Core Responsibilities

1?? Daily Search Term Optimization (CRITICAL)

-Review search terms every single day

-Add negatives to eliminate wasted ad spend

-Ensure budget flows toward high-intent keywords

-Protect campaigns from irrelevant or low-quality traffic



We want clean accounts. No wasted clicks.



2?? Ad Optimization (Bi-Weekly Refresh Minimum)

-Review ad performance regularly

-Identify low-performing headlines and descriptions

-Refresh weak assets (without fully rewriting ads unless necessary)

-Continuously improve CTR and conversion rates



3?? Asset Optimization

-Review and optimize:

  -Sitelinks

  -Callouts

  -Structured snippets

  -Images (where applicable)

-Replace lower-performing assets



Ensure all assets are relevant and conversion-focused



4?? Landing Page Alignment (GoHighLevel Funnels)



We build landing pages inside GoHighLevel.



You will:

-Create or duplicate landing pages for specific ad groups

-Match headlines to high-performing search themes

-Ensure message match between keyword ? ad ? landing page

-Improve conversion rates through alignment



(You do NOT need to be a designer. This is primarily headline/message alignment using templates.)



5?? Conversion & Qualified Lead Tracking (Very Important)

We ONLY optimize for qualified leads, not just form fills.



You will:

-Monitor incoming leads

-Ensure qualified leads are being pushed back into Google Ads properly

-Verify that conversion data is being received correctly

-Make optimization decisions based on qualified conversion data (not vanity metrics)



6?? Campaign Strategy & Growth

-Help create new campaigns

-Assist with bid strategy decisions (Max Clicks ? Max Conversions ? tCPA)

-Identify winning ad groups and keywords

-Scale what works, pause what doesn’t



You will work directly with leadership on performance strategy.



? What We’re Looking For

-Minimum 2+ years hands-on Google Ads experience

-Strong understanding of:

  -Search campaigns

  -Keyword match types

  -Negative keyword strategy

  -Conversion tracking

  -Smart bidding strategies

-Strong analytical thinking

-Detail-oriented (you enjoy finding inefficiencies)

-Comfortable working with data daily

-Fluent written English

-Reliable internet and work setup



???? Personality Fit (Very Important)

We are looking for someone who is:

-Proactive (does not wait to be told what to fix)

-Detail-obsessed

-Analytical

-Accountable

-Growth-minded

-Calm under pressure



If you are easily overwhelmed or need constant instruction, this role is not for you.



???? Required With Application

To be considered, please submit:

1. A short summary of your Google Ads experience

2. Screenshots (with sensitive data blurred) of accounts you’ve managed

3. A short Loom video (3–5 minutes) explaining how you optimize search terms

4. Your DISC personality test results (screenshot or PDF)



You can take a free DISC test here:





???? Compensation

-Competitive monthly salary (based on experience)

-Performance-based bonuses possible

-Long-term growth opportunity

-Potential to manage multiple accounts as we scale



???? Growth Opportunity

We are building toward managing 100+ accounts.

If you perform well, you will grow with us.



We value:

-Excellence

-Integrity

-Systems

-Long-term thinking



How to Apply

Start your application with the words:

“Search Terms Matter”



This helps us filter serious applicants.



Then send all required materials.

title: Cold Callers, Appointment Setters and Closers Wanted! Build Your Sales Career Here!
description:
APPOINTMENT SETTERS WANTED – BUILD A REAL SALES CAREER



Our client is hiring ambitious, salary + commission-driven appointment setters who want more than a job — they want a career path.



This role is perfect for individuals who:



Thrive in fast-paced outbound environments



Are motivated by performance and results



Want to grow with a North American company in scale mode



WHAT YOU’LL DO



- Make high-volume outbound calls using a power dialer

- Qualify prospects and book sales demos

- Work inside a modern CRM (GoHighLevel)

- Use AI-powered call recordings and transcriptions to improve performance



NOTE:

- You do NOT close deals as our North American based Senior Division sales reps handle all closing! 



WHAT WE PROVIDE

- Proven scripts and offers

- Full CRM + power dialer access

- AI call analysis and coaching

- Clear expectations and performance metrics

- Long-term growth opportunities



CALLING HOURS



We operate during business hours across:



Primarily North American Shifts in EST, MT, CST and PST



International shifts opening up across the world for various campaigns! 



Shifts available are as follows. (Please note that all shifts are SHOWN BELOW IN EASTERN TIME!) Please convert to your country's local time. 



Shift #1 - North America EST: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM EASTERN TIME (Canada and US)



Shift #2 - North America MT: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM EASTERN TIME (Canada and US)



Shift #3 - North America PST: 11:00 AM – 8:00 PM EASTERN TIME (Canada and US)



Shift #4 - Europe (UK / IE): 3:00 AM – 12:00 PM EASTERN TIME 



Shift #5 - Australia / New Zealand: 5:00 AM – 2:00 PM EASTERN TIME (Australia and New Zealand)



WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR

- Confident English speakers

- Appointment setters comfortable with high call volume

- Reliable, coachable, and competitive

- Hungry to earn and grow

- Sales, call center, or appointment-setting experience is a plus — but MINDSET matters most.

- Experience with Google Sheets, GHL and Slack are a bonus - however we will train on all tools.



We will do sales levels and assessments with you after 30 days and 90 days. Exact salary + commission rates will be discussed during the interview process with our highest salary and commission level available after 90 days! The commissions are very generous with an UNLIMITED CAP ON YOUR POTENTIAL EARNINGS! All leads will be warm and provided to you through our CRM!



Apply now if you want to be part of something serious.



We look forward to helping you grow your career!



TO APPLY: Please COPY AND PASTE THE LINK BELOW INTO YOUR BROWSER! Fill out the form from there. 







Thank you!

title: Virtual Assistant to Upload Online Courses to Skool (Short-Term Project)
description:
Overview: ?Looking for a detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to help upload and organize over 120 to 150 existing online courses into my Skool platform. This is a short-term project (approximately 50 hours total/3 course uploads each hour) focused on repetitive, process-driven work. All course videos are already hosted on Vimeo.



You must be comfortable following clear step-by-step instructions, working inside online platforms, and keeping accurate records in a tracking spreadsheet.



Responsibilities

• Log into Vimeo and Skool using credentials provided

• For each course:

• Locate the correct videos in Vimeo

• Copy the correct shareable Vimeo link for each lesson video

• Create or open the corresponding course inside Skool

• Add new lessons/pages in Skool and embed the Vimeo video using Skool’s video feature

• Add lesson titles (provided in a document or spreadsheet)

• Add short descriptions or notes when provided

• Check that each video plays correctly inside Skool (desktop and mobile preview when possible)

• Update a shared Google Sheet to track:

• Course name

• Lesson title

• Vimeo link used

• Skool lesson URL (optional)

• Status (Not Started / In Progress / Complete)

• Report any issues (video not playing, embed errors, missing videos, etc.) promptly

• Follow the established Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) and suggest improvements if something can be done more efficiently

Requirements

• Strong attention to detail and ability to follow step-by-step instructions

• Reliable internet connection and a computer that can handle multiple browser tabs

• Prior experience with any course platform (e.g., Teachable, Kajabi, Thinkific, Skool, etc.) is a plus

• Familiarity with Vimeo or other video hosting platforms is a plus

• Comfortable using:

• Google Sheets

• Loom or similar screen recording tools (for occasional questions)

• Basic communication tools 
, chat)

• Able to work independently with minimal supervision once trained

• Good written English for reading instructions and naming lessons correctly



Project Details

• Type: Short-term project (approximately 50 hours)

• Hours: Full-time or near full-time during the project (open to part-time if you are very efficient)

• Payment: Hourly or fixed monthly amount (to be discussed; please include your expected rate)

• Schedule: Flexible hours, but must be able to provide a daily progress update

• Start date: As soon as the right person is selected

How You’ll Be Trained

• You will receive:

• A clear video SOP (screen recording) showing the exact process step-by-step

• Written checklist or instructions for each stage (Vimeo ? Skool ? Spreadsheet)

• Access to all necessary logins and links

• First task will be a paid test course (one full course upload) to confirm understanding and quality before proceeding with the full set.

How to Apply?Please include the following in your application:

1 A short introduction about your experience as a VA

2 Any experience you have with:

• Skool, or other course platforms

• Vimeo or other video hosting tools

3 Your internet speed (include a recent speed test screenshot or link if possible)

4 Your expected hourly rate (in USD) and available hours per week

5 A brief description of a past project where you handled repetitive data-entry or upload tasks and how you ensured accuracy

This role is ideal for someone who is patient, organized, and enjoys clearly defined, repeatable work. If you’re careful with details and like checking things off a list, you’ll do very well in this project.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Job Title: Virtual Executive Assistant

Type: Part-Time (15–25 hours/week)

Location: Remote (with flexible availability across U.S. time zones)



About the Role

We’re seeking a high-energy, detail-oriented Virtual Executive Assistant to support two fast-paced real estate entrepreneurs — both ambitious, creative, and growth-focused — in running dynamic businesses centered around short-term rentals, real estate design, and client relationships.

This role blends strategic executive support, social media and marketing coordination, system optimization, and sales or client outreach. You’ll work closely with two Founders who value initiative, transparency, and partnership — one highly driven and structured, the other relational and visionary — and your job will be to help translate ideas into action, bring order to operations, and manage projects that keep the business thriving.



Key Responsibilities



Executive Support (for Both Founders)

Manage and maintain calendars, schedules, and meeting coordination for two busy executives.

Handle
 and inbox management, ensuring timely responses and surfacing priorities.

Coordinate travel, appointments, and logistics, including occasional personal or household tasks.

Prepare meeting agendas, weekly summaries, and progress reports.

Oversee organization of digital assets, contracts, and documentation.



Operations & Project Management

Track and manage key initiatives, ensuring deadlines and deliverables stay on schedule.

Identify process inefficiencies and propose solutions to streamline workflows.

Utilize business tools (e.g., CRM, project management systems, dashboards) to maintain accountability.

Implement and maintain organized systems for smooth day-to-day operations.



Marketing, Social Media & Content Creation

Create, edit, and schedule engaging videos, graphics, and social media posts (especially Instagram Reels).

Develop social media strategies that reflect each brand’s tone and personality.

Monitor engagement metrics and suggest creative ways to grow visibility and reach.

Write compelling captions, newsletters, or promotional content as needed.



Sales & Client Relations

Make and track follow-up calls to leads and potential clients.

Represent both Founders with polished communication and professional warmth.

Nurture client relationships through great service, follow-up, and attentiveness.

Ideal Candidate



You’ll thrive in this role if you:

Are naturally proactive, upbeat, and communicative — you love connecting with people.

Stay calm under pressure but move quickly when things need to happen.

Balance creativity and structure — strong with both marketing flair and operational systems.

Have solid tech skills across project management, CRM, and creative tools (Canva, Adobe, video editing).

Enjoy juggling diverse responsibilities and collaborating with driven, entrepreneurial leaders.

Adapt well to working styles that are visionary and relationship-driven — anticipating needs before they’re stated.



Qualifications

2+ years of experience supporting entrepreneurs or executives.

Strong background in social media management and/or content creation.

Excellent communication, multitasking, and prioritization skills.

Experience with client relations, lead nurture and screening new leads

Expert in administrative organization, system set up and weekly reports.

Reliable internet connection and ability to work independently in a remote setting.



Personality Match

You’re confident but coachable — comfortable giving and receiving feedback.

You thrive on variety and 
ntum — no two days will look the same.

You have the initiative and follow-through to help two entrepreneurs stay ahead of their goals.



Application Instructions

To apply, please send your resume, a short cover letter describing your fit for supporting both Founders, and examples of social media content or system improvements you’ve created.



Include “I am ready for Legacy Collective” in the subject line to be considered.

title: Business Analyst — E-commerce Platform Consolidation
description:
The Situation



We currently have three separate systems that have grown organically:



- One tracks wholesale purchasing from 10+ suppliers, monitors stock locations, and calculates per-order profitability on Amazon

- One syncs our Amazon product listings across to eBay and Shopify, handles pricing, and routes orders through Amazon's fulfilment network

- One pulls monthly settlement and payout data from each marketplace and produces a consolidated financial report



All three are built on AWS (Lambda, DynamoDB) with React dashboards. They share some of the same marketplace APIs but were built independently, with different coding patterns and some overlapping logic.



We want to bring these together into a unified platform and add accounting automation (Xero) so that marketplace payouts automatically generate invoices and reconcile against bank payments and develop the platform into a commercial solution that can be sold on.



What We Need

Someone who can look at this situation and help us figure out what to build and why — before we write code. The kind of person who:

- Asks the right questions before jumping to answers

- Can map out business processes and spot where systems overlap or conflict

- Understands e-commerce operations (marketplaces, fulfilment, settlements)

- Can bridge the gap between business needs and technical implementation

- Is comfortable working alongside developers and AI tools, not threatened by them



How to Apply



Don't send me a generic CV or a list of tools you know. Instead, tell me:

1. What stands out to you about the situation described above?

2. What would you want to know before getting started?

3. What do you think the biggest risk is in a consolidation like this?

title: Property Manager
description:
W Group Holdings is seeking a highly organized, resourceful, and versatile Property Manager to join our operations team. We have built a work environment centered on collaboration and teamwork, where every member is set up for success through the full support of our entire staff. We provide the necessary training and resources to ensure you feel confident and supported as you master your role and grow within the company.

In this position, you will work one-on-one with our Chief Operating Officer (COO), providing vital support across various property management functions. While the majority of your daily responsibilities involve reporting to the COO, you will also collaborate with and report to our VP for property turnovers and maintenance-related items to ensure our portfolio remains in top-tier condition.



Benefits

Paid Time Off (PTO): 10 PTO days after 6 months, then 15 PTO days starting in employment year 3.

Paid Holidays: All US Federal Holidays off, plus Good Friday.

Growth & Training: Comprehensive training on all company systems and a positive work environment with opportunities for professional advancement.



Key Responsibilities

Financial & Legal Management: Directly manage collections with a persuasive and persistent approach.

Remote Legal Oversight: As this is a remote position, you will oversee the legal process by preparing and filing all necessary court documents.

Tenant Relations: Manage tenant communications and foster positive relationships by effectively addressing grievances and inquiries.

Maintenance & Quality Control: Coordinate maintenance requests and manage vendor relationships.

Visual Accountability: We strictly adhere to a "visual proof" standard; no task is considered complete without clear photo documentation attached to the record.

Year-Round Reliability & Emergency Response: We seek a tea
mber who demonstrates consistent, year-round reliability in all functions. To show us you have a sharp eye, please include the phrase pierogies are awesome in the subject line of your
/message. You will serve as the point of contact for emergency response situations; while these cases are rare, they require immediate action when they occur, with an increased likelihood of i
 during the winter season.



Qualifications & Tools for Success

We believe that excellence in property management is achieved through a dedicated effort to master the fundamentals while continuously striving to improve and learn new skills. We are looking for a candidate who maintains a growth-oriented mindset and a sharp eye for detail in every task. Our ideal tea
mber brings:

Professional Experience: A minimum of 2 years of experience as an End-to-End Property Manager or in a highly relevant/similar role is required.

Property Management Software Proficiency: Proficiency in property management software and other remote communication tools.

Operational Discernment: The ability to process information logically and prioritize tasks based on their impact on property safety and company operations.

Intellectual Resourcefulness: A commitment to "Internal Due Diligence"—if you encounter a new challenge, your first instinct is to exhaust all internal resources (SOP libraries, leases, and historical files) to learn the "why" and "how" before seeking guidance.

Logic-Based Thinking: While we utilize modern tools, we value managers who perform a "Logic Audit" on their work to ensure every recommendation or resolution is accurate, fact-checked, and professional.

High Versatility: The ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervision, effectively managing shifting daily tasks and prioritizing responsibilities as they arise.

Experience: Proven experience in property management or a related field is preferred, and knowledge of Eviction & Section 8 housing programs is a plus.

Communication Mastery: Excellent written and verbal skills for effective remote interaction, including "closed-loop" communication to confirm when tasks are completed.

Technical Requirements: Must have a personal laptop or desktop computer running Windows 10 or a comparable operating system capable of fully supporting video conferencing (built-in or external webcam, microphone, and speakers required). title: Experienced B2B Cold Caller (High Commission $200)
description:
*** PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE DESCRIPTION BEFORE CONTACTING ***



Hey I am Jordan - the founder of a fast-growing company that helps small businesses never miss a call using an A.I. Receptionist. This is a no-brainer service that every business needs, and I am looking for sharks to help me introduce it to small business owners.



We are not a huge corporate where you are just a number. I am only looking for 2-3 people to closely work with to make sure you are setup for success.



WHAT YOU’LL DO



- Source your own leads

- Call small business owners and book them for a free consultation

- That’s it. You do NOT close deals - our closing team handles everything. Your only job is getting them to show up.



MUST HAVE ( Do Not Contact If This Does Not Describe You )

- Experience with B2B cold calling

- Reliable internet

- Quiet workspace

- Excellent english with no heavy accent

- Put the phrase "dial and smile" as your subject so we know you read this

- We offer 2 pay plans:

$2/Hour + $25/Signup

OR

$200 per signup (no hourly)

- Monthly performance bonuses



WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR

- Someone who knows how to communicate, follow up, and book appointments

- Comfortable messaging with business owners all day



HOURS

- Part-time (20 hours/week)

- 2:00 AM – 6:00 AM Philippine Time



ONLY APPLY IF

- You’re a hustler

- You’re motivated by huge commissions

- You have the discipline to work independently and make it happen



SUMMARY

- It only takes finding 3-4 business owners a month to make $600-$800 plus bonuses (and that is for PART TIME work).



CONTACT

- Do not just copy and paste a generic message, I read each one individually to see if you are a good fit

- Tell me 2 specific things: Your prior B2B experience AND why specifically this role works for you

title: Content Researcher - Find Viral TikTok & Instagram Content
description:
About us: Hello! We build consumer ios apps and grow them through short-form content.



We’re looking for someone whose only job is to find breakout content on TikTok and Instagram - early, fast, and consistently.



This is not a data entry job. This is a taste/pattern recognition position.



What You’ll Do



• Find TikTok & IG posts that meet strict performance criteria

• Identify content that is genuinely taking off (not recycled trends)

• Track engagement metrics and posting velocity

• Organize links cleanly in a structured sheet

• Deliver daily batches of qualified posts



No outreach. No editing. No posting. Research only.



----



What We Care About



• Strong judgment - can tell what’s actually viral vs. average

• Ability to follow clear criteria without cutting corners

• Organized, clean tracking (Google Sheets)

• Consistency (we need daily output)

• Fast learner

• Experience & confidence using VPNs to access US algorithm



Bonus: If you already research viral content or study trends for fun.



----



Hours & Pay



• 4–6 hours per day to start (can grow)

• Very flexible schedule

• $4–5/hour depending on experience

• Performance raises for high-quality sourcing



----



How to Apply



Must send:

1. 3 recent TikTok or Instagram posts you believe are “breaking out” right now in the *MOBILE APP SPACE*

2. A short explanation (1–2 sentences each) on why

3. Your expected hourly rate



Applications without examples won’t be reviewed.

title: Legal Assistant for Law Firm
description:
We are a boutique law firm serving clients in a regulated industry and are seeking a detail-oriented, proactive Part-Time Legal Assistant to join our team.



This is a remote position for up to 20 hours per week, and the candidate must be available to work during U.S. business hours (Eastern Standard Time). 



About the Role



The Legal Assistant will support the lead attorney with administrative, organizational, and client-facing responsibilities in a fast-paced, compliance-focused environment. This role requires strong attention to detail, excellent written communication skills, and the ability to manage multiple priorities with professionalism and discretion.



Key Responsibilities



- Draft, format, and proofread legal and business correspondence

- Assist with document preparation, filings, and compliance-related submissions

- Maintain organized digital files and internal tracking systems

- Communicate with clients and potential clients in a professional and courteous manner

- Draft and send engagement letters

- Manage deadlines and calendar reminders

- Support billing coordination and invoice follow-ups

- Oversee internal process documentation and task tracking

- Proofread firm blogs and other documentation

- Prepare PowerPoints for presentations

- Create images for social media posts

- Schedule meetings and calls

- Assist with potential client intake, follow up with inquiries, and (over time) conduct introductory phone calls



Qualifications



- At least one year prior experience as a legal assistant or in an administrative role within a professional services environment

- Strong written and verbal communication skills

- Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail

- Ability to work independently and meet deadlines

- Comfort working in a structured, regulated environment

- Tech-savvy and comfortable with remote collaboration tools



Work Requirements



- Part-time (up to 20 hours per week)

- Must be available during U.S. Eastern Time business hours

- Proficiency in Google Drive



How to Apply (Applications that do not follow instructions will not be considered)



To be considered, please:



- Use the word Anchor in the headline/subject line of your application.

- Include at least 5 apply points explaining why you are a strong fit for this role.

- Submit your resume.

- Provide a brief written summary describing what you are looking for in your next position.

- Include a short video introduction (2–3 minutes) telling us about your background and why this role interests you.



We are looking for someone who values precision, professionalism, and clear communication, and who wants to be part of a collaborative, high-standard environment.



We look forward to reviewing your application.

30-second voice recording

title: eCommerce Accounting Analyst(part time)
description:
Job Title: eCommerce Accounting Analyst(part time)



We are a rapidly growing eCommerce company seeking a highly analytical and detail-focused Accounting Analyst to play a key role in our month-end close and financial reporting processes. This position is ideal for someone who thrives in a fast-paced small business environment and has a strong foundation in accounting, data validation, and technical reporting across multiple sales channels.



Key Responsibilities

Month-End Close & Reconciliation:

 Take ownership of the month-end close process by reconciling revenue,  fees, refunds, and settlements across multiple eCommerce platforms, including Amazon, eBay, Walmart, Shopify, Kohl’s, TikTok Shop, Target Plus, Michaels, Etsy, OTC, and Faire.





Excel & SQL Analysis:

 Utilize advanced Excel functions (Pivot Tables, Power Query, VLOOKUP/XLOOKUP, data models) and basic SQL queries to clean, analyze, and audit large data sets for trends, anomalies, or mismatches.



Data Validation & Integration:

 Collaborate closely with the internal database team to validate raw data exports and financial reports, ensuring accuracy before importing into QuickBooks Desktop using specialized import tools or templates.







QuickBooks Posting & Reconciliation:

 Import validated data into QuickBooks, allocate properly to accounts, and reconcile against previous balances, account summaries, and transaction-level reports.





Documentation & Issue Tracking:

 Maintain detailed documentation for recurring discrepancies, resolution steps, data anomalies, and improvements to workflows for internal knowledge sharing and continuity.





Cross-Team Coordination:

 Communicate proactively with purchasing, operations, and customer service teams to resolve financial discrepancies and plan ahead for financial cutoffs or reporting deadlines.





Problem Solving with Strategic View:

 Identify gaps in current workflows and propose automation or procedural enhancements without losing sight of overall financial objectives and timelines.





Night Shift Availability:

 Must be available to work during night hours to support collaboration with global tea
mbers and to meet reporting deadlines aligned with operational needs.







Qualifications

Education:

 Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.





Experience:

 Minimum of 2 years of hands-on accounting experience, preferably in an eCommerce, retail, or multi-channel environment involving platform settlements and large transaction volumes.





Technical Skills:





Advanced Excel: Proficiency in Pivot Tables, Power Query, data clean-up and reconciliation workflows





SQL (Basic): Ability to write or modify queries to extract or check data from internal databases





QuickBooks Desktop: Familiarity with posting, importing transactions, and reconciling accounts





Communication & Organizational Skills:





Able to communicate clearly and effectively via Google Chat, Gmail, Google Calendar, and shared spreadsheets





Excellent attention to detail with the ability to manage priorities and meet tight deadlines





Work Style:

 Self-motivated, able to work independently, and comfortable in a fast-changing, team-oriented, small business environment.







If you’re passionate about using your accounting and data skills to bring clarity to complex multi-platform eCommerce operations, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Google Ads Specialist (Insurance Marketing)

You will build, optimize, and scale paid search campaigns focused on local lead generation in the insurance industry.

This is not a beginner PPC role. You must understand data, performance metrics, and how to turn insights into action.

If you love improving results week after week and enjoy working in a focused niche, this role is for you.



What You’ll Be Responsible For

1. Campaign Setup & Management

Find opportunities to scale winning campaigns

Explain what’s working, what’s not, and what actions you’re taking



4. Collaboration & Growth

Work closely with the team on landing pages and automation

Contribute ideas to improve systems and results

We sometimes ask for flexible support on related tasks, but nothing outside your skill set—and always with clear communication.



Tools You Must Be Comfortable With

Bing Ads

Google Tag Manager

Keyword research tools

Reporting tools (Google Sheets, Looker Studio, etc.)

GoHighLevel (or similar landing page builder – preferred)

Requirements

Strong understanding of CTR, CPC, CPA, ROAS, and Quality Score

Experience setting up and troubleshooting conversion tracking

Strong written English (you will write ad copy)

Highly organized and detail-oriented

Able to manage multiple accounts at once

Self-starter who does not require micromanagement

Available during PST business hours (Monday–Friday, 9AM–6PM PST)



Full-Time | Remote | PST Hours Required

Rate: $5–$8/hour (depending on experience)



Bonus (Not Required, But a Big Plus)

Google Ads Certification

Experience with
/Meta Ads

Landing page optimization experience

Background in insurance, financial services, or local lead generation

Experience with automation platforms



Why Join Us?

Fully remote position

High-impact role where your work drives real business growth

Clear systems and expectations

Opportunity to grow long-term with the company



We are excited to have you onboard!!!

title: Client-Facing Senior Accountant - A Team Champion
description:
You are probably not looking for a job, but you are looking to make a difference in the world both professionally and personally. You have been working in a position that challenges you and allows your detailed oriented skills to shine, but without an impact, it's left you feeling hollow and empty. Your inner voice keeps telling you that you should be getting so much more out of your career, but you have tried to ignore it because of global uncertainty. What if your inner voice is right? What if there was a career path where you can flourish and also make an impact in the world?



Maybe it's time for you to hop on a new train and enjoy the ride forward in a new and rewarding direction. What if this new train was uniquely positioned to enhance your career growth while also satisfying your desire to make an impact in the world? What if you were encouraged to make an impact as a core part of your career growth? We encourage you to join our impact driven team.



Problem Solved

Imagine being on the front lines of helping support orphanages though helping lead a team that is at the forefront of financial management for small businesses, agencies, and fast growth tech startups! We both focus on helping fast growth founders scale and grow their businesses through accounting and tax consulting while also giving back by supporting our network of orphanages in Mexico.



As our Senior Accountant, you will serve as the jack of all trades accounting ninja for our fast growing accounting and tax team in a fast paced environment. You will directly impact the organization by helping our dynamic clients with their financial backoffice. The work you do will directly impact your professional and personal growth as well as the companies and orphans we serve.



Job Requirements:

CPA with more than 5 years of experience working with Quickbooks Online.

Natural born leader or demonstrated ability to take leadership and oversee the work of others.

Exceptional comfort and confidence leading client meetings via Zoom—you are great in face-to-face client interactions with a Western Native tone.

Willing and able to work on a night shift(California PST hours).

With strong experience collaborating directly with US-based clients.

With advanced skills in excel and other accounting reporting platforms and tools.

Accurate and timely.



Responsibilities:

Accounting

Provide clean, accurate and timely bookkeeping for clients in accordance with GAAP or cash basis books.

Collaborate directly with US based clients. This is a customer facing role.

Lead client meetings via Zoom with confidence and professionalism, presenting financials and strategic recommendations.

Communicate with clients through Slack,
 and Zoom meetings about their financials, A/R, A/P, payroll, billings etc.

Help create visually impactful spreadsheets to help clients determine their forecasts, budgets, expansion plans etc.

Utilize AI tools like Claude and ChatGPT to help streamline accounting processes.

Help clients identify areas of improvements and efficiencies. This role is not for a typical bookkeeper, but for an accountant that is strategic and looking out for the clients best interests.

Provide high level reporting to management and overseeing client work and tasks.

Take ownership of client relationships and team deliverables, ensuring excellence across all touchpoints.

Service delivery; ensure timely responses to clients, flag and escalate issues as appropriate.



In the first 30 days you will conquer the following:

You will quickly navigate and learn our systems and processes with Monday.com, Slack, Ignition, as well as our payment gateways of Quickbooks. We have a library of training videos that have been created by our amazing admin team that will need to be completed within the first 30 days. You will be assigned client cases and collaborate with your managing accountant and client success manager to ensure that client work is handled smoothly and efficiently. Your success will be measured by you completing clients reconciliations on time and a satisfactory report from surveying clients.

You will establish a fun working relationship with team members from both our Accounting and Tax divisions and be present at every team meeting.



In the first 60 days you will conquer the following:

You will be a genius at analyzing the clients that have been assigned to you and identify gaps in their accounting, whether it's unnecessary recurring expenses, untracked items in balance sheets, streamlining of chart of accounts etc. We will be confident enough in your work to be able to allow you to work relatively independently. You will begin taking on leadership responsibilities, reviewing peers' work and leading client presentations.



You will have identified an orphanage or other child related cause for us as a company to sponsor and champion for Q3.

If this is you, let us help you grow!!



You are someone that is detail oriented, friendly and firm, with a friendly communication style that our clients will enjoy. You are a natural leader who can inspire and guide others while maintaining accountability. You have a can-do attitude and a service oriented spirit. You have a knack for problem solving and helping create win-win solutions. You have a keen eye for building spreadsheets that our clients feel gives them clarity and confidence. You are energized by face to face client interactions and excel at presenting complex financial information in clear, compelling ways via video meetings.



You are a CPA with at least a solid 2 years of experience working directly with clients, are proficient with accounting skills, have experience in a busy remote office and have a knack for quickly learning new skills and tools. You are excited to work California (PST) hours and to collaborate with your team members. You like the challenge of learning new systems and always love to take things apart to see how they are put together and improve them.



This is a fully remote position, so you will have stellar internet connection and present professionally in front of zoom. You will need to be available for daily and ad hoc meetings during PST business hours.



Why You'll Love Working With Us

At The Cashflow Doctor, we've built more than just a company—we've created a supportive, great team that truly cares about each other's success and well-being. Here's what makes working with us special:

Low-Stress Environment: We prioritize healthy workloads and realistic expectations so you can do your best work without burnout.

Flexible Fridays: Complete your 8-hour workday on your own schedule every Friday.

15 Days Paid Time Off Per Year: Distributed as 3 days after your first 90 days, then 3 days per month until your annual allotment is reached.

End-of-Year Bonuses: We reward your hard work and dedication.

Birthday Holiday: Your birthday is an additional company holiday to celebrate you.

Work Anniversary Recognition: We honor your contributions with personalized gifts.

Supportive Team Culture: Join a team that genuinely supports each other, celebrates wins together, and helps each other grow.

Mission-Driven Work: Make a real impact by supporting orphanages and charitable causes in Mexico.

Professional Growth: We invest in your development with training, mentorship, and opportunities to lead.



About Us

At The Cashflow Doctor, we do everything we can to help fast growth founders to scale and grow their companies through sensible accounting and tax strategies. We leverage technology and creative thinking to save our clients both time and money. Part of our core mission is to give back to society. The founder is on the board of a nonprofit orphanage based in Mexico as well as a board member of a non profit group that builds homes in the Ensenada area of Mexico.



Here's your Call to Action!

We hire talented people from around the world based on evidence of your accomplishments and cultural alignment. If you've read this far, we invite you to apply so you can have the opportunity to do the same. Resumes are standard but we are more curious about how you answer our assessment questions you'll find in the application process.

title: Integrations Associate – Automation & Systems
description:
DAP Brands is seeking a detail-oriented, technically savvy, and solution-driven Integrations Associate to support our mission of building seamless, scalable automations across the organization. This role goes beyond task execution. You’ll work closely with our Technology Integration Manager to design, maintain, and optimize workflows that improve efficiency across Sales, Marketing, and Operations.



If you enjoy connecting systems, solving process gaps, and leveraging automation tools to create reliable, intelligent workflows, this role is for you.



Key Responsibilities:

- Integration Setup & Maintenance: Assist in setting up, testing, launching, and maintaining integrations using platforms such as Zapier, Make, and GoHighLevel. Monitor automations for accuracy and performance, troubleshoot issues, and implement long-term fixes.

- Automation & Workflow Optimization: Identify inefficiencies in existing processes and propose smart automation solutions. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand needs and build tailored workflows.

- Technical Support: Work with APIs, webhooks, and basic scripting (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL) to resolve data sync issues, system errors, and performance bottlenecks.

- Documentation & Training: Document workflows, integrations, and processes to ensure scalability. Assist in training internal users on newly built systems and automation tools.



Tools You’ll Work With:

- Automation & Integrations: Zapier, Make, Webhooks

- CRMs & Operations Tools: GoHighLevel, ClickFunnels, Stripe, ClickUp

- Collaboration Tools: Google Sheets, Zoom, Google Workspace

- Scripting & APIs: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL



Application Instructions:

Please submit your application through the online form provided: 



- To be considered, you MUST type “MAVERICK” in front of your full name if you are applying via our website: 

- If you are an Integrations Associate who takes ownership, thinks in systems, and thrives in a fast-moving, automation-driven environment, we invite you to apply.

title: Accounts Payable Specialist (Real Estate)
description:
As part of our sourcing and endorsement process, you will be placed directly with a growing multifamily real estate investment and property management company serving communities across the Southeast US. You’ll have ongoing coaching, clear standards, and a dedicated Success Manager so you can focus on delivering excellent work and growing in your role.



About the Role

We are looking for an Accounts Payable Specialist to manage the full vendor-to-payment lifecycle across multiple properties. You will work in a structured, multi-entity environment where precision, compliance, and proactive problem-solving are essential.

You’ll validate POs, process invoices, reconcile accounts, resolve discrepancies, and execute payments in RealPage, ensuring that financial records are accurate, audit-ready, and aligned with budgets.



Key Responsibilities

Review approved vendor proposals and complete compliant onboarding in RealPage (COIs, W-9s, banking info, etc.)

Validate Purchase Orders created by Community Managers and approved by Regional Managers before invoice matching

Process vendor invoices with accurate GL coding and correct entity allocation

Reconcile proposals, POs, invoices, and payments prior to fund release

Investigate and resolve discrepancies to prevent duplicate or incorrect payments

Perform weekly and monthly reconciliations across multiple property-level accounts

Reconcile vendor statements and proactively resolve variances

Execute check runs, ACH, and wire payments according to schedules

Ensure all invoices are recorded in the correct accounting period to support month-end close

Maintain organized, audit-ready AP records across the portfolio

Support 1099 preparation and year-end vendor reporting

Identify and implement process improvements to strengthen AP accuracy, compliance, and automation



Requirements / Non-Negotiables

2–4 years of Accounts Payable experience in multifamily, real estate, or property management

Proven experience reconciling multiple property-level accounts across separate entities

Hands-on experience with RealPage (preferred) or similar systems like Yardi or AppFolio

Strong understanding of purchase order workflows, vendor onboarding compliance, and invoice processing controls

Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and general ledger/AP accounting systems

Experience executing ACH, wire, and check payment runs

Fluent written and verbal English communication

High attention to detail with zero tolerance for financial inaccuracies

Proactive, structured, and consistent in following processes



Full-time availability Monday–Friday, 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM EST



Benefits

Competitive salary

Paid US holidays

Paid wellness days

Health & wellness allowance

Monthly profit sharing

AI, operations, and leadership upskilling

Dedicated Success Manager and long-term placement support



How to Apply

If you meet the requirements and are ready to take ownership of a high-volume, multi-entity AP workflow, submit your resume. Only candidates who meet the non-negotiables will be considered.

title: Microsoft Teams Expert Needed – Fix Guest User Access & Media Sharing Issue

Microsoft 365 Admin Center
