Teams messaging policies



External collaboration settings



File sharing permissions (SharePoint / OneDrive integration)

Review our Teams and M365 admin settings



Fix the configuration properly



Explain clearly what caused the issue



Show us best practice for adding external users correctly



Prevent this chaos from happening again

Available for a live working session

Technical Requirements (NON-NEGOTIABLE):

- MUST work on camera throughout entire shift (required)

- MUST share screen while working during all scheduled hours (required)

- These requirements exist because you will be handling sensitive client data and information

- Reliable high-speed internet connection (minimum 10 Mbps download, 5 Mbps upload)

- Working webcam with clear video quality

- Headset or working microphone

- Quiet, private workspace where client information cannot be overheard



Skills:

- Strong English communication skills (accent-neutral preferred)

- Customer service mindset

- Professional, reliable, and detail-oriented

- Comfortable with outbound calling

---

TRAINING SCHEDULE:



Week 1 Training (Monday - Thursday ONLY):

- Schedule: 7:00 AM - 4:00 PM Central Standard Time

- Includes 1 hour lunch break (11:00 AM - 12:00 PM)

- Hands-on, paid training provided

- Must pass final assessment to continue to regular work schedule



After Training:

- Regular shift begins (either 10 AM-2 PM OR 2 PM-6 PM CST)

- Monday - Friday

- No weekends, No US holidays

---

WHY WORK WITH US?



- Competitive pay at $4.00 per hour

- Part-time role with predictable hours

- Limited inbound call pressure (mostly outbound work)

- Independent work environment

- Opportunity to grow within the company

- Join a stable, reliable company with 15 years in business

- Hands-on paid training provided

- Monday-Friday schedule (No weekends, No US holidays)

- Professional, supportive work environment



---



TO BE CONSIDERED, YOU MUST SUBMIT:



1. A short video OR voice note (1-3 minutes) that includes:

   - Introduction of yourself

   - Description of your relevant experience for this role

   - Where you live and your age

   - Why you left your previous role (if not currently employed) OR details about your current role including job duties and schedule (if currently employed)



2. Updated resume



3. Reference information



IMPORTANT NOTES:



Camera & Screen Sharing Policy:

Working on camera and sharing your screen during all scheduled work hours is NON-NEGOTIABLE. This requirement exists to protect sensitive client data and ensure security compliance. If you cannot meet this requirement, please do not apply.



You may turn off your camera and stop screen sharing during scheduled breaks and lunch periods only.



We look forward to hearing from you!

title: GHL Website Builder (Mobile-First + Custom CSS) – Paid Project Trial
description:
About OHANA Marketing



OHANA means family.

We are a U.S., faith based, digital marketing agency serving:



• Automotive dealerships

• Home service companies



We build conversion-focused websites and marketing systems inside Go High Level that help businesses turn traffic into real booked jobs.



We value:



• Strong relationships

• Clear communication

• Professional excellence

• Long-term partnerships



We treat our team with respect and expect the same in return.

If you’re looking for short-term freelancing or random side projects, this won’t be the right fit.

If you want to grow with a company and bring real value, keep reading.



Hiring Structure (Important – Please Read)



We will begin with a paid project trial in March focused specifically on Go High Level website building.

The project will test:



• Mobile-first design

• Custom CSS ability

• Conversion-focused layout

• Communication skills

• Speed of delivery



If the project is successful, this role will transition into an ongoing part-time position (15–20 hours per week) starting in April.

We prefer this structure so both sides can confirm a strong long-term fit.



The Purpose of This Role

We are looking for someone who can:



• Build and customize GHL websites

• Improve templates using custom CSS

• Think mobile-first and conversion-first

• Support marketing execution

• Occasionally join client Zoo
etings



This is not just a task-based role.

We are looking for someone who can work independently, stay organized, and add thoughtful value to projects.



Full Scope of Responsibilities

Website & Conversion (Primary Focus)



• Build and customize websites inside Go High Level

• Improve templates using custom CSS

• Make pages look custom — not templated

• Ensure strong mobile responsiveness

• Improve spacing, typography, and hierarchy

• Test forms and lead capture before launch

• Deliver page builds within 48 hours once content is provided



We care deeply about conversion and mobile experience.

Marketing Operations Support (Secondary Focus – After Trial)



• Schedule and organize marketing tasks

• Upload blog posts and landing pages

• Schedule social content

• Assist with basic
 setup

• Help prepare materials for client meetings

• Track simple project progress



This may expand over time based on performance.

Client Interaction



• Occasionally join Zoom calls with U.S.-based clients

• Confidently explain updates or design decisions

• Communicate clearly in spoken English



You do not need to sell.

You do need to speak professionally and confidently.



What Success Looks Like (First 90 Days)



• You work independently without constant reminders

• You communicate clearly and proactively

• You deliver quality work on time

• You bring thoughtful improvement ideas

• You represent OHANA professionally



We value initiative and maturity.



Required Skills



• Strong experience building full websites inside Go High Level

• Experience using custom CSS within GHL

• Basic HTML understanding

• Strong mobile-first design thinking

• Understanding of conversion-focused layout

• Fluent spoken and written English

• Reliable internet and professional Zoom setup



Bonus Skills



• GHL Certification

• Experience with home services or automotive industries

• Basic SEO knowledge

• Canva experience

• Experience working with U.S.-based agencies



Hours & Compensation



• Paid project trial in March

• Transition to 15–20 hours per week part-time in April (if successful)

• Competitive PH hourly rate based on experience and quality



A small paid test project will be part of the hiring process.



How To Apply

Please submit:



Your CV

3 live GHL websites you personally built

A 3–5 minute Loom video explaining:



How you improved a template using custom CSS



How you approached mobile-first conversion



A short 1–2 minute introduction video so we can hear your spoken English



Your hourly rate



Start your application with:



“I BUILD MOBILE-FIRST CONVERSION SITES.”



Applications without this line will not be reviewed.



We are building something long-term and relationship-driven.



If you are dependable, skilled, and take pride in your work, there is real opportunity to grow with us.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
About Us:

Elise Buie Family Law Group is a dynamic and compassionate law firm committed to transforming family law through innovative solutions and deep empathy. Our team thrives on excellence, integrity, and a growth mindset. We are looking for a gritty, detail-oriented administrative tea
mber who is ready to jump in, support our team, and help us achieve our mission.



Position Overview:

We are looking for an experienced and self-driven administrative tea
mber to provide critical support to our family law firm. This is a fast-paced, detail-oriented role where strong organizational skills, an ability to manage multiple priorities, and excellent communication are key. You will assist with everything from calendar management to documentation, making sure our internal operations run smoothly and effectively.



As a key player in our team, your role will be crucial to ensuring deadlines are met, meetings are scheduled efficiently, and the team has the resources they need to provide the best possible service to our clients. If you thrive on keeping tasks organized and working collaboratively, this is the perfect opportunity for you!



Key Responsibilities:



Calendar & Scheduling: Coordinate and manage calendars for tea
mbers, scheduling meetings and appointments, ensuring that all information is organized.



Administrative Support: Provide general administrative support, including filing records, sorting mail, and managing office supplies.



Communication: Serve as a liaison between vendors, clients, and internal tea
mbers, ensuring smooth communication and timely follow ups.



Process Improvement: Identify opportunities for improving office management processes and implement new systems to improve efficiency.



Team Support: Assist with scheduling, preparing documents, and supporting various administrative tasks as needed.



Confidentiality & Compliance: Maintain confidentiality and adhere to legal standards and firm policies.



Project Coordination: Track action items and follow up to ensure completion.



Documentation: Create and maintain SOPs, templates, and documentation to increase efficiency and consistency.



Reporting: Demonstrate comfort handling data by organizing, updating, and verifying information in spreadsheets and digital tools to support accurate reporting and operations.



Team Player: Assist with other tasks as requested.





Qualifications:



At least 2 years of administrative experience, preferably in a law firm or fast-paced environment.



Proven experience managing calendars, scheduling meetings, and meeting tight deadlines.



Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to build rapport with a variety of people.



High level of emotional intelligence with the ability to navigate complex interpersonal dynamics.



A detail-oriented mindset with a focus on accuracy, follow-through, and consistency.



Ability to work independently, as well as collaboratively as part of a remote team.



Experience with Dropbox, MS Office 365, Slack, and video conferencing tools (Zoom, etc.) is preferred.



Experience with Clio or similar legal software is a plus.



Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to adapt in a fast-paced environment.



Must pass a background check and have reliable internet and phone access.





Who You Are:



You bring a high level of determination, with a proven ability to navigate obstacles and see initiatives through to completion.



You thrive on being detail-oriented and making sure no task is left incomplete.



You communicate with clarity and intention, ensuring shared understanding and consistent alignment.



You take a proactive approach to identifying process improvements and confidently contribute new ideas.



You collaborate effectively with a positive, solutions-focused mindset and actively support team goals.





Why Join Us?



Meaningful Work: Contribute to a team reimagining family law through compassion, integrity, and thoughtful innovation.



Growth & Learning: We prioritize continuous learning and professional development and actively support your growth at every stage.



Team Environment: Join a supportive, collaborative, and mission-driven team that values radical candor and personal development.



If you are ready to contribute your administrative expertise to a team that values integrity, compassion, and growth, we encourage you to apply. Join the Elise Buie Family Law Group and help make a meaningful impact for the families we serve.





Apply here: 
/1if0xH1r9RyOaT3ZrmuKqBAbu4hz

title: Executive Assistant
description:
ABOUT THE COMPANY



We are an established remote support services company that connects busy professionals and growing businesses with skilled, English-speaking virtual assistants. With over a decade in business, we have helped clients around the world save time so they can focus on what matters most. We are selective about who we hire because we believe our clients deserve the best. We are more than a service — we are a team that cares about doing great work, supporting each other, and making a positive impact.



--------------------------------------------------



ROLE OVERVIEW



We are hiring an Executive Assistant who will work directly with one or more clients. You will act as their trusted support person — helping them stay organized, saving them time, and keeping their business running smoothly.



This is more than just completing tasks. We need someone who can think ahead, spot problems before they happen, and take action without being told. You will be the person your client depends on every day.



--------------------------------------------------



WHAT YOU WILL DO



CALENDAR,
 & SCHEDULING



- Manage your client's calendar, schedule meetings, and resolve time conflicts. Many clients work across different time zones, so careful coordination is required.

- Coordinate calls, video meetings, and appointments — both business and personal.

- Check and organize your client's
 inbox. Flag urgent items, respond to routine messages, and draft replies using your client's tone and style.

- Prepare short daily or weekly summaries so your client knows exactly what is coming up.



BUSINESS OPERATIONS & ADMIN TASKS



- Keep CRM (Customer Relationship Management) records up to date by adding contacts, updating deal stages, and ensuring information accuracy.

- Assist with invoicing, expense tracking, and following up on unpaid bills. Some clients may also require basic bookkeeping support.

- Create and maintain SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures) that document recurring processes.

- Communicate with vendors (suppliers, software providers, service companies) on your client's behalf.

- Manage software subscriptions and account logins.

- Book flights, hotels, and transportation for business or personal travel.



PROJECT COORDINATION



- Use project management tools (such as Asana, Monday, Trello, or ProofHub) to track tasks, deadlines, and project progress.

- Follow up with tea
mbers and stakeholders to ensure work is completed on time.

- Prepare meeting agendas in advance and distribute action items after meetings.

- Support onboarding of new hires or contractors when clients expand their teams.



COMMUNICATION & PEOPLE MANAGEMENT



- Serve as the first point of contact for your client's messages, including
, chat, and occasionally phone calls.

- Write professional
s, proposals, follow-ups, and thank-you messages on behalf of your client.

- Handle customer questions or concerns, knowing when to resolve issues independently and when to escalate.

- Coordinate podcast appearances, speaking engagements, or media opportunities when applicable.



RESEARCH & DECISION SUPPORT



- Conduct research on competitors, market trends, potential partners, software tools, or service providers.

- Present findings in clear formats such as summaries, comparison sheets, or short presentations.

- Assist with special projects such as event planning, product launches, outreach campaigns, or candidate sourcing.



MARKETING & CONTENT SUPPORT



- Schedule and publish social media posts using tools such as Buffer, Later, or Hootsuite.

- Write or edit blog posts, newsletters, and marketing content.

- Create simple graphics using Canva or similar tools (advanced design skills not required).

- Monitor social media activity and flag important comments, messages, or trends.



HANDLING CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION



- You will have access to sensitive business information. Absolute confidentiality is required.

- Protect your client's time by managing access to them professionally and tactfully.



--------------------------------------------------



WHAT YOU NEED (REQUIRED)



- At least 3 years of experience as an Executive Assistant, Senior Virtual Assistant, or similar administrative support role.

- Strong written and spoken English communication skills.

- Experience managing calendars and coordinating across multiple time zones.

- Proficiency with Google Workspace, Microsoft Office 365, and video conferencing tools such as Zoom or Google Meet.

- Experience with at least one project management platform (Asana, Trello, 
, ProofHub, or similar).

- Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail.

- Ability to work independently and take initiative.

- Reliable high-speed internet and a quiet, professional workspace.

- Availability during U.S. business hours (Eastern or Pacific overlap required).



--------------------------------------------------



NICE TO HAVE (PLUS, NOT REQUIRED)



- Experience with Go High Level (GHL) for contact or pipeline management.

- Experience using QuickBooks Online for invoicing, expense tracking, or basic bookkeeping.

- Social media management experience for business accounts.

- Familiarity with additional CRM platforms such as Salesforce or HubSpot.

- Strong content writing skills for blogs, newsletters, or marketing copy.

- Basic graphic design skills using Canva, Adobe Express, or similar tools.



--------------------------------------------------



WHY CHOOSE US



- WORK FROM ANYWHERE — Fully remote role with location flexibility.

- LONG-TERM STABILITY — We prioritize ongoing placements rather than short-term gigs.

- RELIABLE PAY — Competitive compensation with consistent, on-time payments.

- LEARN AND GROW — Access to training resources and exposure to diverse industries and tools.

- SUPPORTIVE TEAM — Collaborative remote environment with team communication channels and virtual events.

- MEANINGFUL WORK — Direct support for business owners and executives.

- POSITIVE IMPACT — We believe in contributing positively to the communities where our tea
mbers live.

- ESTABLISHED COMPANY — Over a decade in business with continued growth and stability.



--------------------------------------------------



APPLY HERE



To submit your application, visit: 
/4ceIS5q

title: [Hiring] GoHighLevel Specialist (Operations & Systems Implementation)
description:
The Opportunity:



We are a high-performing digital marketing agency currently in a phase of active growth. We are seeking an experienced Go High Level Specialist to take full ownership of our technical operations and systems implementation.



We don't need a general assistant; we need a technical expert who understands the "why" behind automations. Your primary goal will be to ensure our client delivery engine runs flawlessly, allowing our team to stay focused on high-level growth and client strategy.



Compensation & Earning Potential:



Earning Potential at Fully Ramped: High performers in this role will earn between $1,050 – $1,350+ USD per month through a combination of base pay and performance-based bonuses.



Base Pay (Post-90 day Probation): $850 USD/month.



Starting Base Pay for 90 Day Probationary Period: $720 USD/month paid bi-weekly during the initial 90-day integration phase.



The Launch Bonus: You will receive a $37.50 USD bonus for every new client sub-account. (Majority is templatized) (Full technical setup + A2P + Workflow testing completed).



Key Responsibilities:



1. Technical Setup & Deployment



Execute full Go High Level sub-account setups for new clients (phone numbers,
 configuration, and domain masking). (Sub accounts are templatized and 80% complete at start)



Build, import, and customize funnels, websites, and landing pages using existing snapshots and templates.



Create and manage complex automation workflows, triggers, and multi-channel campaigns.



Integrate GHL with third-party platforms via Zapier or native integrations to ensure data flow.



2. Ongoing Management & Optimization



Act as the lead for troubleshooting technical issues and providing ongoing backend support.



Proactively optimize funnels and workflows to improve conversion rates and performance.



Monitor and report on key metrics and campaign health within the GHL dashboard.



Maintain "System Hygiene" (mapping custom values/fields) to ensure snapshots deploy correctly.



Essential Skills & Qualifications:



GHL Mastery: 2+ years of proven experience building and managing full GHL ecosystems.



Problem-Solving: Strong analytical abilities. You see a broken trigger as a puzzle to solve, not just a task to report.



Attention to Detail: You are process-oriented and double-check every "if/then" branch before going live.



Communication: High-level English proficiency. You can clearly explain technical logic via Slack or Loom.



Availability: Reliable, consistent, and available for daily syncs during Canadian EST business hours.



How to Apply: Please visit the following link to submit an application: https://contractorfuel.skysr.co/ghl-specialist-application





(Please note: direct messages will automatically reject you from this opportunity)

title: Senior WordPress Developer
description:
Senior WordPress Developer



Full Website Rebuild | Project-Based | Remote



We are a well-established, woman-owned luxury holiday and architectural lighting design company based in Chicago, serving residential and commercial clients for more than 22 years.



We are preparing to rebuild our entire website and are seeking a highly skilled Senior WordPress Developer who can execute from structured wireframes while bringing refined design sensibility and deep technical expertise.



This is not a simple update role. This is a full rebuild. We are providing clear wireframes and framework direction, but the developer must understand how to translate structure into a dynamic, elegant, high-performing WordPress site.



The Project



* Full WordPress website rebuild

* Execution based on provided wireframes and framework

* Maintain defined look and feel aligned with a premium brand

* Build a dynamic, visually beautiful, responsive site

* Structure the site for both AEO (Answer Engine Optimization) and SEO (Search Engine Optimization)

* Ensure speed, mobile responsiveness, and technical performance



What We Need



* Deep expertise in WordPress architecture, themes, and custom development

* Strong understanding of AEO and SEO structure, schema, metadata, and page hierarchy

* Ability to follow wireframes precisely while elevating the design execution

* Strong eye for layout, spacing, typography, and visual balance

* Experience building elegant, high-end, conversion-focused websites

* Ability to create a dynamic site that is easy for our internal team to manage post-launch



We are essentially giving you the playbook. We need someone who can execute it beautifully and technically correctly.



Ideal Candidate



* Highly detail-oriented

* Understands nuance within WordPress, not just surface-level editing

* Can balance structure with aesthetic refinement

* Communicates clearly and professionally

* Comfortable working independently with defined deliverables



Compensation Structure



This is a project-based engagement, not hourly.



* Project fee based on scope

* Milestone-based payment structure

* Potential for ongoing work after launch for refinements and seasonal landing pages



We value clarity, accountability, and high-level execution. We are looking for someone who takes ownership of their craft and delivers with precision.



How to Apply



Please include:



* A short introduction outlining your WordPress experience

* 3 to 5 examples of full websites you’ve built or rebuilt

* Your specific role in each project

* Experience with AEO and SEO-structured builds

* Your proposed project-based pricing range



We are proud to be a woman-owned company built on elegance, professionalism, and thoughtful design. Our website must reflect that standard.

We are looking for an experienced Virtual VA Bookkeeper who can step in immediately due to a tea
mber’s health emergency.

?? IMPORTANT

title: Final Cut Pro Podcast Producer
description:
?? Application instructions are at the bottom of this job description - we will only consider applicants who have followed them.



About us:



We're a small, organised production team (currently 3 people) based in the UK, producing podcasts and content for founders, SMEs, charities, and creators. We're hiring one editor to join us.



This is a process-driven role. We'll share multicam recordings from our ATEM Mini ISO with you via a proxy workflow. You'll format them according to our process, complete the edit, and return the finished assets. That's the job.



This doesn't require creative strain. If you're looking for a steady, straightforward role and you've got a capable machine and internet that can handle the files, this could be a great fit.



* This role is not for freelancers juggling multiple clients. It's for someone who wants to work with one company, follow clear systems, and do consistently good work.



Important Note



We read every genuine application personally. In return, we ask that yours is genuinely yours. We want to hear your voice, your experience, and your words, not something generated by AI and pasted in. AI-written applications will not receive a response. If you've actually read this description and feel it's the right fit, that will come through clearly. If you haven't, that will too.





What you'll do day-to-day



Edit multi-camera podcast and content sessions in Final Cut Pro, following our SOPs. This includes file organisation, assembly, colour correction, audio mixing and repair, and exporting deliverables: full-length episodes (video and audio), short-form social clips, and occasional promos or trailers.





Requirements



- Strong proficiency in Final Cut Pro (non negociable)

- Good ear for audio, comfortable with EQ, compression, and noise reduction for spoken word

- Excellent English communication, both spoken and written

- Reliable, detail-oriented, and comfortable working at pace

- Systems-minded, you follow processes accurately and flag when something needs to change



Technical setup (non-negotiable)



- Apple Silicon Mac (M1 or newer)

- 16GB RAM minimum

- 2TB dedicated SSD storage

- Stable high-speed internet



Bonus (will give you an advantage): Motion graphics, animation, YouTube/VSL editing, graphic design



Schedule



Training and onboarding will take place during UK hours (Monday–Friday, 9am–6pm). Once you're fully up to speed, we're flexible on your working hours as long as deadlines are met and there's reasonable overlap for communication.



How to apply 



Applications that do not follow these steps will not be reviewed.



Step 1, Send a video introduction (required)

Record a 1–3 minute video of yourself answering the following. This is the first thing we'll look at, and it's the easiest way to show us you're a real person who's actually read this.



1. What makes you different from other applicants?

2. How does your experience meet the requirements listed above?

3. What are your professional goals?

4. Tell us a bit about yourself personally, we're a small team, so we want to get to know you personally!



Step 2. Include your portfolio link

Show us your best work, not a Google Drive full of random samples



Step 3 — Confirm the following in writing

- You meet the technical setup requirements listed above (include a screenshot of your internet speed)

- The hours you're available to work



Step 4 —
 subject line

Your subject line must include the word *Human* so we know you've read this in full.



If this sounds like it was written for you, we'd love to hear from you.



— Jacob, Founder, Liverpool Podcast Studios

title: Video Editor for Aviation Documentaries – Long-Term
description:
We are looking for a talented Video Editor to join the team for our YouTube channel.



We produce high-quality, long-form aviation documentaries. Our content explores everything in the range of aviation. We aren't just looking for someone to "cut clips"—we need a storyteller who can use pacing, sound design, and archival footage to create a sense of mystery and tension.

Example channels (these are examples so we don’t want copies of it)













What You Will Be Doing

Cinematic Editing: Creating 15-20 minute documentary-style videos with a "video essay" feel.

Visual Sourcing: Finding high-quality B-roll, historical aviation footage, technical diagrams to explain complex flight concepts, create overlays, animations and motion graphics.

Atmospheric Sound Design: Our videos are using background music but very soft. Only the first 5 seconds should be louder.

Retention Hooks: Crafting intense, "must-watch" openings in the first 60 seconds.

Collaboration: Using Trello to receive scripts/voiceovers and manage feedback.



Who We Are Looking For

The Documentary Specialist: You understand how to maintain interest over a 15 - 20 minute video.

The Technical Eye: You can visually represent what the narrator is saying.

Software: Proficient in Adobe Premiere Pro, DaVinci Resolve, or After Effects.

Aviation Interest (Huge Plus): If you know your Boeing from your Airbus, you’ll love this role.



Compensation & Growth

Pilot: We start with a 1-minute test edit to check for style alignment.

Trial Video: $10 for your first full 15-20 minute video.

Ongoing Rate: Once established, we move to $15 per video with a consistent workflow of 3 videos per week. Every minute over 20 minutes is an extra $1

We are looking for a long-term partner to grow with the channel.



How to Apply

We only review applications from people who pay attention to detail. To apply, please follow these steps:

Start your application with the word "MAYDAY".

Provide links to 1–2 examples of faceless documentary-style videos you have edited (Aviation, History, or Engineering niches are a huge plus).

Write a 2-3 sentence note on what you think makes a "hook" successful in a documentary about an aviation

Confirm your typical turnaround time for a 15-20 minute edit once you receive the voiceover and script.

Note: Applicants who do not include the keyword or samples will be automatically disqualified.



What you’ll receive

We’ll send you:

The full script and voiceover 

Complete and honest feedback



Budget + payment

We pay per video. For this test video, the budget is $10 for a 15-20 minute video with voiceover and B-roll. If the quality is strong and delivery is smooth, we’d love to move into a long-term partnership with more videos per week at a $15 rate for a 15-20 minute video.



Payment is released after the final approved edit. The better the channel gets the higher the fee goes per video.

title: Liverpool Podcast Studios - Producer
description:
**Important note**

Attention to detail is highly important to us, and so the first step of the application process is ensuring you have fully read the entire job description and followed all instructions clearly. We respect your time and we ask you do the same, so any mass applications will be disregarded.



Hello! I'm Jacob, the founder of Liverpool Podcast Studios, the UK's leading production studio creating world-class podcasts and content for founders, SMEs, charities, and creators. We deliver a high volume of client work every week and we do it through clear systems, consistent standards, and a calm, professional well established workflow. 



We're currently a small team of just 3, and we're now looking for the right person with the right values and skillset to join our growing team and work in an environment where you'll do the best work in your career! 





What you’ll be doing

 • Editing multi-camera podcast and content sessions in Final Cut Pro

 • Processing projects through a repeatable workflow: file organisation, assembly

 • Colour correction / grading to a consistent standard

 • Audio mixing and repair when needed (clean-up, levelling, improving clarity for spoken-word)

 



Requirements:

 • Strong proficiency in Final Cut Pro (we will provide you with a licensed version)

 • A keen ear for audio and the ability to adjust processing tools such as EQ, compression and noise reduction tools

 • Highly reliable and consistent

 • Excellent proficiency in English and the ability to communicate clearly and confidently 

 • Systems-minded: you follow processes accurately and communicate clearly when something changes

 • Great attention to detail and excellent time management



Required setup

 • Apple Silicon computer (M1 or newer)

 • 16GB RAM minimum

 • 1TB of dedicated SSD storage

 • Stable high-speed internet



How to apply



We only review applications that follow the instructions below exactly.



1)
/Application subject line must include the secret word: 'Liverpool' so we know you have read this far!



2) Include your portfolio link 

The best way to show me your skill and attention to detail is to show me your best work.



3) Record a short video introduction, introducing yourself and answer these questions clearly:

- What makes you different from the other applicants applying for this position?

- Outline your experience and how you meet the listed requirements above

- Confirm you meet the technical setup requirements listed above

- Confirm what hours we can expect you to be available to work

- I want to support you in doing the best work of your career here with us. What are your professional goals/aspirations?



also.. don't be afraid to tell me a little bit about yourself personally! We will be working in a small team together so it's important to me to know a little more about you! :-) 



If this role is perfect for you, I can't wait to meet you soon!

title: Executive Recruiter – U.S. Construction Industry
description:
Compensation: Base salary + commission, unlimited earning potential



**JOB OVERVIEW**



Are you competitive, confident on the phone, and motivated by performance-based income?

We are hiring a Recruiter to support a U.S.-based executive search firm specializing in construction and infrastructure leadership placements.



This is not a sourcing-only role. You will speak directly with U.S. professionals, build relationships with passive candidates, and help drive real placements. The work is phone-heavy, relationship-driven, and results-focused.

If you want a long-term recruiting career with real income upside, this is that opportunity.



**What You’ll Be Responsible For**

• High-volume outbound calls to U.S.-based professionals

• Engaging passive candidates who are not actively job seeking

• Conducting structured discovery conversations

• Managing candidate pipelines in CRM

• Supporting submissions, interviews, and placement follow-up

• Consistently hitting outreach and performance KPIs



You will receive structured training, scripts, systems, and ongoing support.



**Must-Haves**

• Strong spoken and written English

• Confident phone presence

• Experience engaging passive candidates (recruiting or outbound sales)

• Comfortable working Philippines night shift aligned to U.S. time zones

• Reliable high-speed internet and backup power

• Quiet, professional home workspace

• Comfortable making a high volume of outbound calls daily



**Nice-to-Haves**

• U.S. recruiting experience (agency or executive search preferred)

• Experience with LinkedIn Recruiter, ZoomInfo, or CRM systems

• Background in outbound sales or talent acquisition

• Experience working with U.S.-based teams



**What We Offer**

• USD base salary plus performance-based bonuses

• Long-term, full-time employment

• Structured onboarding and coaching

• Clear advancement path based on results

• Established U.S. firm with decades of industry presence



This is a performance-driven environment. Strong producers grow quickly.



If you think you have what it takes, apply now.

Bonus: Leave a 1–2 minute voice or video recording telling us why you're a great fit. Candidates who do will be prioritized.



If your background aligns, we will contact you for the next step.

title: Payroll Specialist
description:
Payroll Specialist (Part-Time | Remote)



The Opportunity

We’re hiring a detail-driven Payroll Specialist (Part-Time | Remote) to support a healthcare solutions organization specializing in infectious disease services and public health support.



This role plays a critical part in maintaining accurate payroll records for internal clinical and administrative teams operating in a highly regulated environment. You’ll be responsible for validating employee hours and mileage, ensuring payroll data integrity, and delivering reliable reports that leadership depends on.



You’ll work within a structured remote team, collaborate with internal stakeholders as needed, and take full ownership of payroll data quality. This opportunity is ideal for an experienced payroll or reporting specialist who values precision, confidentiality, and consistency—and who is comfortable supporting operations tied to sensitive healthcare services.



Key Responsibilities:

- Verify and validate employee work hours and mileage using Hubstaff tools

- Prepare accurate payroll-related reports and dashboards

- Perform detailed data entry, data validation, and data cleanu

- Maintain organized payroll documentation and records

- Conduct quality assurance checks to ensure accuracy and completeness of payroll data

- Submit thorough, high-quality reports to internal stakeholders



Candidate Profile

Required:

- 2–5 years of experience in payroll, reporting, or related specialist-level roles

- Expert-level proficiency with Hubstaff, including reporting and hour/mileage verification

- Strong skills in data entry, data validation, and quality control

- Experience using Google Workspace and Microsoft Office / Microsoft 365

- Professional working proficiency in English

- Ability to work approximately 4 consistent hours per day (flexible schedule within regular business hours)

- Strong attention to detail with the ability to work independently



Preferred:

- Advanced proficiency with required tools

- Process improvement or optimization mindset



About Our Client

Our client is a healthcare solutions organization specializing in infectious disease care, operating as a network of experienced infectious disease providers led by a board-certified physician with over 18 years of clinical leadership experience.

They support both in-person and telehealth services, enabling accessible, efficient care while maintaining rigorous operational and compliance standards behind the scenes. Their multidisciplinary team is focused on improving healthcare outcomes through proactive disease management, education, and data-driven operational processes.



The organization’s mission centers on:

- Reducing hospital admissions and re-hospitalizations

- Lowering medication-related costs

- Providing education and support to healthcare staff

- Effectively managing and containing infectious disease outbreaks



This is a highly structured, compliance-focused healthcare environment where accuracy, accountability, and reliable reporting play a critical role in supporting clinical and administrative teams.



About Intelus Agency

Intelus Agency is a remote staffing and talent-matching firm that helps businesses and agencies hire reliable, role-trained remote professionals. Intelus manages sourcing, screening, placement, and ongoing support for all roles we staff. While candidates work day to day with our clients’ teams, Intelus remains the primary point of coordination throughout the engagement.



How to Apply

If you meet the requirements outlined above and are interested in this opportunity, please complete our quick and easy application form below by uploading your resume and submitting a short 1-minute introduction video. Intelus Agency will review applications and contact qualified candidates regarding next steps.

title: High-Ticket SaaS Sales Closer (Canadian Tech) | Remote
description:
ARE YOU A HUNTER?

We are a Canadian-based technology company. We are looking for an ambitious Sales Hunter, not an order taker. We sell a "Smart Web Lead Management & Automation System" that businesses actually need.



THE PRODUCT:

You aren't selling "air." You are selling a high-value automation tool.



* The Market: North America (Canada/USA).

* The Pitch: We help businesses automate growth. It works.

* The Opportunity: The product is solid, meaning the chance of "Zero Sales" is near nil if you put in the work.



THE MONEY (BASE + HIGH COMMISSION):

We are looking for a partner, not an employee. We are willing to invest in the right person.



* Base Salary: Negotiable. (We are happy to discuss a base retainer for a candidate with a proven track record).

* The Commission: This is where you make your real money. You earn approx. 14,000 PHP ($335 CAD) for every single sale.

* The Target: Close just 2 deals a month = 28,000 PHP.

* The Accelerator: Continue earning 14,000 PHP for every single sale after that.

* The Potential: Uncapped. Our top reps aim for 60,
,000+ PHP monthly.



THE ROLE:



* Outbound Hunting: You will call North American businesses (EST hours) to demo our software.

* Closing: You are not just setting appointments; you are closing the deal.

* Tools: We provide the dialer, the leads, and the training. You bring the hustle.

* Schedule: Flexible, but you must be willing to make calls during Canadian Business Hours (Eastern Standard Time).



WHO YOU ARE:



* Hungry: You prefer uncapped commission over a limited salary because you know you can sell.

* Experienced: You have done outbound B2B sales or appointment setting before (SaaS preferred).

* Tech-Savvy: You can learn a new software product quickly so you can demo it with confidence.

* Resilient: You have a thick skin and a neutral/professional English accent.



HOW TO APPLY (STRICT REQUIREMENT):

I am looking for a star. To prove it is you:



1. Send a message with the subject line: "I'm Hungry"

2. Include a link to your resume/profile.

3. MANDATORY: Include a link to a 60-second voice recording (Vocaroo or Google Drive) telling me why you prefer commission sales.



Note: Applications without a voice recording will not be reviewed.

description:
Who This Is For



This role is NOT for beginners, theory-only marketers, or people who “set and forget” campaigns.

What You’ll Be Responsible For



Owning Google Ads performance end-to-end for our e-commerce brand(s).



Scaling Shopping & Performance Max campaigns while maintaining or increasing ROAS.



Structuring campaigns based on products, margins, and intent — not guesses.



Optimizing bids, budgets, audiences, and search terms daily.



Managing Google Merchant Center feeds (titles, images, attributes, disapprovals).



Implementing advanced conversion tracking (GA4, GTM, enhanced conversions).



Running constant A/B tests on ads, feeds, audiences, and landing pages.



Cutting losers fast and doubling down on winners.



Delivering clear, actionable performance reports (no vanity metrics).

title: Senior Accountant & CPA
description:
Senior Accountant & Finance Systems Architect

CPA Preferred | 10+ Years Experience | Hybrid/Remote



About the Role

We're hiring a Senior Accountant who operates at the intersection of accounting rigor and operational engineering. This is not a traditional accounting seat. We need a seasoned CPA who has lived in the trenches of hedge funds, high-growth startups, and complex multi-entity operations—and who brings the rare ability to build scalable, automated finance systems from the ground up.

You'll own the full finance function: month-end close, financial reporting, forecasting, compliance, and investor-ready deliverables. What sets this role apart is the expectation that you will also architect and automate the systems behind these processes—leveraging SQL, Brex, and modern tooling to eliminate manual work, improve data integrity, and unlock strategic insight.



What You'll Own

Financial Reporting & Close

Lead monthly, quarterly, and year-end close processes across multiple entities and currencies. Prepare US GAAP-compliant financial statements, management reports, and board-ready materials. Own revenue recognition, accruals, journal entries, intercompany eliminations, and reconciliations. Manage fund accounting, NAV calculations, and investor reporting as applicable.

Forecasting, Budgeting & Strategic Finance

Build and maintain dynamic forecasting and cash flow models that inform executive decision-making. Lead annual budgeting cycles and deliver monthly variance analysis with actionable narrative. Partner with leadership on scenario planning, capital allocation, and profitability analysis.

Finance Systems & Automation

Design, build, and maintain automated financial workflows that eliminate manual bottlenecks. Write SQL queries (PostgreSQL) for financial reporting, data extraction, and reconciliation at scale. Develop Python scripts for trading system integrations, API-driven data pipelines, and financial automation. Build BI dashboards  and custom reporting systems for real-time financial visibility. Implement AI-assisted process optimization to continuously improve finance operations.

Compliance, Tax & Legal Coordination

Oversee payroll processing, sales tax compliance, and government reporting requirements. Manage government compliance filings, loan applications, and audit preparation. Coordinate with external counsel and auditors on contract reviews, regulatory matters, and legal documentation.



Requirements

Non-Negotiables



Active CPA license in good standing

10+ years of progressive accounting experience spanning fund accounting, startup finance, and/or multi-entity operations

Deep expertise in US GAAP financial reporting, monthly close, and consolidation

Proficiency in SQL (PostgreSQL preferred) for financial data querying and reporting

Hands-on experience with Python for financial automation, API integrations, or trading system support

Advanced Excel and Google Sheets skills including complex nested formulas, financial models, and automated dashboards

Demonstrated ability to design and implement process automation and scalable finance workflows

Experience with QuickBooks Online in a multi-entity environment



Strongly Preferred



Background in hedge fund accounting, NAV reporting, or alternative investment operations

Experience with BI/analytics platforms

Familiarity with Microsoft Access for custom reporting systems

Track record managing payroll, sales tax, and multi-state compliance

Experience with government loan applications (SBA, PPP, EIDL, or similar)

Comfort operating in fast-paced, resource-constrained environments where you build the plane while flying it





What Sets You Apart

You don't just close the books—you ask why the process took 10 days and engineer it down to 3. You see a messy reconciliation and build a powered pipeline to handle it. You understand that clean financial data is a strategic asset, not just a compliance obligation. You move fluidly between debits and credits, scripts, and board presentations.

The ideal candidate combines the analytical discipline of a Big 4-trained accountant with the builder's mindset of a startup operator. You're equally comfortable presenting to investors, debugging a data pipeline, and negotiating with auditors.

title: DM Appointment Setter [Part-time / Flexible]
description:
We’re a creator-led fitness and performance brand operating a fast-growing free community on Skool that ascends qualified members into a premium, high-ticket coaching program.



Our goal is simple: turn engaged community members into booked sales calls through real conversations.



We run a lean, execution-focused operation. People who perform well in this role will grow into higher-leverage positions as the brand scales.



We are hiring a DM Appointment Setter to manage 1:1 conversations inside Skool DMs and ascend qualified community members into booked sales calls.



This role operates directly from the creator / Skool community owner’s account, meaning you will be speaking on behalf of the brand. You must be professional, emotionally intelligent, and capable of representing the creator’s voice accurately.



Your primary responsibility is to:

 • Start conversations with new and active Skool members

 • Build rapport and understand their situation

 • Provide relevant resources inside the Skool community when appropriate

 • Guide qualified members toward booking a sales call via Calendly



Your success is measured by qualified calls booked from the free community.



Soft Skills (Required)



• Strong written communication

• High emotional intelligence

• Comfortable initiating and holding conversations

• Professional judgment when speaking as a brand/creator

• Proactive and self-directed

• Ability to follow structure while adapting to real conversations

• Results-driven mindset



Basic Skills



• Fluent written English

• Comfortable using Skool and DM-based communication

• Google Docs and Sheets

• Ability to follow SOPs and conversation frameworks

• Familiarity with Calendly or similar scheduling tools



Required Experience



• DM-based sales, appointment setting, or community engagement experience

• Experience moving conversations toward a clear CTA (booking a call)

• Understanding qualification vs. disqualification

• Ability to handle objections naturally in conversation

• Experience speaking on behalf of a brand, coach, or creator



Desired Experience



• Experience working inside Skool, Slack, 
, or similar communities

• Experience with high-ticket offers ($3k–$10k+)

• Fitness, coaching, or personal development industry familiarity

• Experience managing multiple DM conversations simultaneously



Detailed Responsibilities



• DM new Skool members as they join the community

• Engage active members showing buying signals

• Hold 1:1 conversations inside Skool DMs from the creator’s account

• Ask qualifying questions to understand goals, problems, and readiness

• Share relevant community resources, posts, or videos when helpful

• Maintain a helpful, non-pushy tone aligned with the brand

• Move qualified members toward booking a sales call

• Send Calendly links at the appropriate time

• Follow up until a clear outcome is reached (booked call or disqualified)



Samples of the Type of Work You’ll Do



• Skool DM conversations

• Qualification and discovery messaging

• Resource sharing inside the Skool community

• Call booking and follow-up messages



Work Schedule & Structure



• Part-time role

• 1–3 hours per day

• Fully remote

• Flexible schedule, results-focused



Compensation



• $5–$6 USD per hour

• Performance-based bonuses tied to booked calls and/or closes

• Paid bi-weekly via Wise



Training Provided



• Full onboarding on the offer, audience, and positioning

• Pre-written DM scripts and SOPs

• Qualification criteria and escalation rules

• Ongoing feedback and performance optimization



Career Potential



• Increased responsibility as volume increases

• Higher pay tied to performance

• Opportunity to grow into senior setter or community leadership roles

• Long-term position with a growing brand



How to Apply



Please submit:

• Your resume/CV

• A 3–5 minute Loom video covering:

– Your experience with DM sales or appointment setting

– How you handle conversations and objections

– Any experience speaking on behalf of a brand or creator



Applications that do not follow instructions will not be considered.



We’re hiring ASAP and looking for someone who wants a long-term role, not a short-term gig. Scripts and training are provided — we’re looking for someone who executes, thinks independently, and is measured by results.

title: Virtual Executive Assistant
description:
I'm the founder of a digital growth marketing company that helps mission-driven founders scale their businesses with more ease & less overwhelm - and I'm looking for a small team of highly-skilled Executive Assistants to help take over the marketing and management tasks that make a huge difference in the lives of the people that hire us.



I'm looking for a max of 5 amazing executive assistants available for part-time (potential for full time) with a salary starting at $500 USD per month and with long term success and robust training, moving up to $700 USD per month as an emerging leader in the company.



If you have the following skill sets, I encourage you to apply:



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:

- Minimum of 3–5 years of experience in Digital Marketing, Video Editing, Social Media Management, Content Creation, and Executive Assistant Work (Administrative Tasks, Calendar &
 Management, etc)

You’re trusted to manage marketing deliverables while providing high-level executive support, keeping priorities organized, systems moving, and leadership focused on growth instead of day-to-day execution. You've done it all from managing schedules to
 & calendar management. You have a meticulous eye for detail where Prioritization and Organization are your love language



-- 1+ years of experience in Sales Funnels and Shopify

You're a professional who is passionate about helping changemakers simplify their lives by setting up systems that will allow them to operate their businesses with more ease and less overwhelm. You have experience with sales funnel and CRM software



- 1+ years of experience advertising on platforms like Instagram,
, Tik Tok, within a Marketing team consisting of Paid Acquisition, Organic Marketing, Customer Retention, & Product Marketing

You're an emerging leader who has the potential to head a team in the future that will report directly to you. Having leadership experience is a MAJOR plus



- Creating SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures)

You’ll ensure each business function has detailed documentation for repeatable and scalable growth if it isn't already place. If you see gaps, you take the initiative to fill them and produce results without anyone knowing there was an issue (yea, all that and a bag of chips :-)



- Experience working at a digital/online product/platform: You’re familiar with online courses, digital products & platforms and popular tools in the business space ranging from landing page builders and
 service providers to CRMs, and course hosting platforms aren’t foreign to you (We teach tools like Shopify, Convertkit, Kajabi, Teachable, Learnworlds, Calendly, etc)



ABOUT YOU:

- “You down with SOP? Yeah you know me!”—You’re an advocate for SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures) to make our systems repeatable & scalable.

- Your love language is processes & predictable, meteoric growth. We never question company progress towards the quarterly and yearly goals because you keep real-time metrics for all projects.

- You’re aware of new software and can look at current systems and identify how to automate tasks a company has been doing manually for months.

- You’re addicted to digital processes & automation in the world of social media because you love building connections in the digital space and you’ve seen how powerful it can be in business growth

- You’re driven by metrics & tracking. You know that you can’t improve something unless you measure it, so you develop ways to measure performance so your company is always predictably improving.

- Timeliness and deadlines are your jam. When we have a team call at 10:00am, you show up at 9:55am. When the deadline is Tuesday at 5:30pm, you have it done Monday.

- You overcommunicate clearly and confidently. If you agree/disagree with something, you communicate that without hesitation or overthinking. You’re no stranger to asking why we do things a certain way to ensure we’re intentional with our resources.

- You’re a leader and team player. Ego? What ego? If something needs to be done, you dive in to make sure all critical tasks are accounted and cared for.



If you’re nodding your head “Yes” to the above, proceed below to apply.



PERKS:

I'm committed to setting our staff up for success with access to trainings that will certify your skills in:

- Task & Calendar Management

- Launch/Sales Strategy Planning

- Sales Funnel Tech Setup (For E-Commerce or Service Based Businesses)

- Social Media Management

- Digital Media Marketing (Including
 and SMS Marketing)

- Lead Generation



After one week of training and assessment, you're officially certified under our internal training program, which means hitting the ground running with your new skills. Perks include:

- Part time work hours

- Work from anywhere in the world (as long as your internet signal is strong and computer is fast)

- Starting Salary at $500 USD a month ($6000 USD annual)

- Internal certification program to enhance your professional skills in your career (I have helped clients amass at least $10M from the same digital growth marketing strategies I will require you to learn)



Interested? Please reply to this post with the secret keyword "APPLES" so I know you can pay attention to detail - from there, I'll let you know next steps if you qualify.

title: Amazon Catalog Manager (Seller Central Expert)
description:
Full-Time | Remote | Long-Term Position



We are a growing U.S.-based premium brand seeking an experienced Amazon Catalog Manager to take full ownership of our Amazon listings, catalog health, and optimization strategy.



This is not an entry-level role. We are looking for someone who understands Amazon deeply — including catalog structure, indexing, variation strategy, flat files, and Seller Central troubleshooting.



If you are analytical, proactive, and focused on improving listing performance, we want to work with you long-term.



---



## Your Role



You will be responsible for the overall health, optimization, and performance of our Amazon catalog. Your work will directly impact organic rankings, conversion rates, and revenue growth.



You will fully own the catalog.



---



## Core Responsibilities



### Catalog Management



* Create and optimize listings (Titles, Bullet Points, Descriptions, Backend Search Terms)

* Build and manage parent-child variations correctly

* Perform bulk updates using flat files (required skill)

* Fix suppressed listings and catalog errors

* Resolve stranded inventory issues

* Maintain listing compliance with Amazon policies

* Manage and update A+ Content



---



### Amazon SEO & Optimization



* Conduct advanced keyword research (Helium 10, DataDive, or similar)

* Improve indexing and organic rankings

* Monitor keyword performance and adjust strategy

* Increase conversion rates through listing improvements

* Analyze competitors and identify ranking opportunities



---



### Image Strategy & Coordination (No Design Required)



You will own the image optimization process, but you will not personally design graphics.



* Conduct image audits to improve click-through rate and conversion rate

* Analyze competitor images and identify improvement opportunities

* Create detailed image briefs for designers (infographics, lifestyle images, comparison charts, feature callouts)

* Coordinate with designers and photographers to ensure brand consistency

* Ensure all images comply with Amazon policies

* Upload and manage image order within listings

* Continuously improve images based on performance data



---



### Seller Central Management



* Open and manage Seller Support cases

* Handle Brand Registry-related issues

* Monitor listing health dashboards

* Ensure correct category placement and attributes



---



## Required Experience



* 3+ years managing Amazon Seller Central

* Strong flat file experience (mandatory)

* Deep understanding of Amazon SEO and indexing

* Experience fixing suppressed listings

* Strong variation strategy experience

* Strong written English skills

* Ability to work independently without constant supervision



---



## Preferred (Bonus) Experience



* Experience working with branded or premium products

* Experience with Brand Registry

* Experience significantly improving conversion rates

* Strong data-driven mindset



---



## Compensation



* Competitive monthly salary (based on experience)

* Performance-based bonuses

* Long-term opportunity

* Growth potential into senior operations role



---



## Work Details



* Full-time

* Remote

* Flexible schedule (some overlap with U.S. hours preferred)

* Long-term commitment required (no short-term freelancers)



---



## How to Apply (Important)



To be considered, please send:



1. A short summary of your Amazon experience

2. 2–3 examples of listings you have optimized

3. A brief explanation of how you improve indexing

4. Your expected monthly salary

5. The phrase “CATALOG OWNER” at the top of your application

6. SEND US LINK TO YOUR CV/RESUME WITH WORK HISTORY



Applications without the required phrase will not be reviewed.



---



We are building a serious team and looking for someone who takes ownership, thinks strategically, and executes at a high level.



If that’s you, apply now.

title: Team Lead – E-Commerce & Creative Operations
description:
Team Lead – E-Commerce & Creative Operations (Remote – Philippines)

Company: HouseSensationsArt (USA)

Pay: $3.50 USD/hour

Hours: 20–30 hours/week (with potential to grow to 30–40 hours).

About the Company

HouseSensationsArt is a fast-growing American manufacturing and e-commerce brand specializing in business signage, custo
tal home décor, and personalized home and commercial signage. We sell across Etsy, Shopify, Amazon, eBay, TikTok Shop, and also work locally and nationally through government contracting. As we continue to scale, we are expanding our remote leadership team in the Philippines.



Position Overview

We are hiring an experienced Team Lead to oversee and manage our multi-platform e-commerce and creative operations ( graphic design). This is a leadership role and a task role.  You will manage people, systems, workflows, and quality across teams while working closely with senior leadership and U.S.-based management. You will also assist with tasks across each platform. This is a long-term role with growth and promotion opportunities for the right candidate.



Key Responsibilities

Team Leadership & Operations: Lead and manage 5 to 8 tea
mbers. Work directly with Senior Lead, Department Leads, and U.S. Management & Design Teams. Oversee E-commerce Product Specialists, Graphic Designers, Marketing Team, Development/Support, IT, Legal, and Customer Service.

Daily Management Duties: Assign and oversee daily tasks. Conduct morning and evening team check-ins. Enforce SOPs, deadlines, and quality standards. Review and approve designs, mockups, product listings, and creative assets. Train staff on workflows, tools, and SOPs. Interview, onboard, and terminate remote employees when necessary. Maintain project boards, forms, files, and documentation.

E-Commerce Platform Management: Oversee and optimize daily operations on Shopify, Amazon, TikTok Shop, Etsy, and eBay. Manage product listings and variations, creative asset coordination, workflow management, quality control and approvals, SKU pricing and category organization, SEO consistency, and brand alignment. Support both B2C and B2B initiatives. Identify gaps, improve processes, and increase efficiency. Report performance, blockers, and metrics to ownership.

Graphic Design & Creative Support: Applicants must have strong design skills. Create and edit listing images, lifestyle graphics, and mockups. Edit vector files (AI, SVG, EPS). Build A+ Content. Ensure brand consistency across platforms.

Required Software Knowledge: Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, Canva.

SEO, Marketing & Content Support: Write and optimize titles, tags, descriptions, and alt-text. Track listing performance and recommend improvements. Assist with social media content 
, Instagram, TikTok, Pinterest), seasonal promotions, and ads 
, Instagram, TikTok). Experience with A+ Content is a plus.

Shopify Web Support (Basic–Intermediate): Edit themes and correct layout or formatting issues. Update pages, collections, and navigation. Work with apps such as Customily, Zepto, and other Shopify integrations.



Required Skills & Experience

Proven experience leading remote teams. Strong working knowledge of Shopify, Amazon, TikTok Shop, Etsy, and eBay. Strong understanding of SEO, branding, product niches, and target audiences. Experience with B2B and B2C sales strategies. Project management experience including task assignment, deadlines, and accountability. Proficient with Google Sheets and project management tools such as ClickUp, Nifty, Asana, or Trello. Fluent in written and spoken English. Excellent leadership, organization, and communication skills.



What We’re Looking For

Dependable and honest — attendance and punctuality are critical. Able to consistently work scheduled hours. Looking for long-term growth, not short-term work. Proactive leader who takes ownership. Strong problem-solver who corrects mistakes professionally. Detail-oriented with high-quality standards. Comfortable in a fast-growing, multi-brand environment. Dependability is non-negotiable; we need someone who shows up every day.



How to Apply

Please
 the following to 

: Resume, Portfolio and work samples (designs, listings, mockups, etc.), Short introduction video, Brief explanation of why you are the best candidate for this role, Screenshot of your internet speed test, Acknowledgement of work hours, salary, TimeProof, NDA, and Contract, Availability to interview, and Start date availability.



We look forward to speaking with you!

description:

title: Need Great Short Form Video Editor
description:
Video Editor (Short-Form Ads + Educational Content)



We’re looking for a skilled video editor who can turn raw footage into engaging, high-retention content for social media.

This role is focused on talking-head educational videos + short-form content (Reels, TikTok, YouTube Shorts) designed to capture attention, hold retention, and drive action.

If you understand pacing, storytelling, and what makes people stop scrolling — keep reading.



???? What You’ll Be Editing

* Talking-head educational videos (marketing/business content)

* Short-form content (30–60 seconds primarily)

* Short form ads to help generate leads

* Clips enhanced with B-roll, captions, zooms, sound effects, and motion

* Content designed to educate + convert, not just look pretty



???? About Us

We are a fast-growing fitness company 

We’re not looking for one-off freelancers, we’re building a  full-time editor who want to grow with us long-term.



If you’re someone who wants consistency, volume, and the opportunity to sharpen your skills in high-performing content… this is for you.





? Requirements

* Proficient in Adobe Premiere Pro OR Final Cut Pro X

* Strong understanding of short-form editing styles

* Ability to add:

    * Engaging captions

    * Pattern interrupts (zooms, cuts, transitions)

    * Relevant B-roll

    * Sound effects & music

* Fast turnaround times (24–48 hours preferred)

* Good communication and ability to take feedback



???? Bonus (Highly Preferred)

* You understand how to maximize retention

* You study viral content and know what makes videos perform

* Experience editing for coaches, agencies, or personal brands

* You think like a marketer, not just an editor

* Interest or experience in fitness content (big plus)

* You think like a marketer, not just an editor



???? Test Edit (Important)

To be considered, you must complete a test edit.

Heres the folder with all the files:







Your goal: Turn it into a high-retention, engaging short-form video.

?? This is an unpaid test. The best edit will be selected for an interview.



???? Opportunity

* Ongoing work for the right editor

* Consistent weekly projects

* Opportunity to grow with a fast-scaling marketing brand



Payment:

Hourly pay with consistent hours weekly

20 to 40 hours weekly as you grow



???? How to Apply

Send the following:

1. Test edit

2. Your editing software (Premiere Pro or Final Cut Pro X)

3. Your typical turnaround time per 60 second video



To verify you read this job posting, Include the word “LEAN” with your application so we know you read everything.

title: Shopify Theme Designer (Fashion Focus) – Full-Time – Long Term
description:
Summary

About Us



We are a fast-growing e-commerce group operating dozens of Shopify stores across Europe and the US.



80% of our stores are fashion-focused, and our goal this year is ambitious:



Build and standardize 100 premium Shopify themes across multiple markets.



We are looking for a highly experienced Shopify Theme Designer who understands not just design — but scalable e-commerce systems.



This is a long-term, full-time position.

Designing mainly fashion-focused Shopify stores (80?shion niche)



Working with both Shopify Theme Store themes and 3rd-party themes



Making themes Google Merchant Center (GMC) compliant from the start



Ensuring clean structure, premium UI, mobile-first design

Maintaining design consistency across all stores

Strong experience designing Shopify themes (not just editing pages)

Experience making GMC-proof themes

Long-term mindset — we are not looking for freelancers hopping projects

Understand CRO and conversion psychology in fashion



Output Expectations



3–5 premium themes per week

Standardized theme framework that can scale to 100 stores



Why Join Us



Long-term stability



High-volume work



Clear structure and SOPs

Direct collaboration with experienced e-commerce operators



If you apply, please include:

Experience with GMC compliance



Your availability and expected monthly salary



We are looking to hire immediately.

title: Shopify & Etsy Store Manager
description:
Full-Time | Remote | U.S. Work Hours Required



We are a growing U.S.-based eCommerce brand seeking a reliable and detail-oriented **Shopify & Etsy Store Manager** to oversee the daily operations of our online stores.



This role includes product listing management, customer service, order processing, and
 marketing coordination. You will ensure our stores run smoothly, customers receive excellent support, and operations are handled efficiently.



This is a long-term opportunity for someone who takes ownership and works independently.



---



## Work Schedule (Important)



* Full-time position

* Must be available during U.S. business hours

* Consistent daily availability required

* Long-term commitment only



Applicants who cannot work U.S. hours should not apply.



---



## Your Role



You will manage the day-to-day operations of our Shopify and Etsy stores, maintaining high standards across listings, customer communication, fulfillment coordination, and
 marketing.



You will be responsible for keeping everything organized, accurate, and running efficiently.



---



## Core Responsibilities



### Store & Listing Management



* Create and update product listings (titles, descriptions, tags, variations)

* Upload and organize product images

* Maintain accurate pricing, product information, and inventory

* Optimize Etsy listings for search visibility

* Ensure consistent brand voice and presentation

* Make updates for new product launches or revisions



---



### Customer Service



* Respond to customer inquiries promptly during U.S. business hours

* Handle returns, exchanges, and refund requests professionally

* Resolve issues calmly and efficiently

* Maintain strong response rates and positive feedback

* Identify recurring issues and suggest improvements



---



### Order Management



* Process daily orders accurately

* Coordinate with fulfillment partners or suppliers

* Monitor shipping and resolve delivery issues

* Handle order changes or cancellations

* Ensure orders are fulfilled on time



---



###
 Marketing & Newsletter Management



* Create and schedule newsletters (Klaviyo, Mailchimp, or similar)

* Coordinate promotional campaigns and product launches

* Manage
 lists and segmentation

* Monitor basic
 performance metrics (open rate, click rate, revenue)

* Maintain consistent brand messaging across
 communications



---



## Required Experience



* Experience managing Shopify and/or Etsy stores

* Experience in eCommerce customer service

* Experience managing
 marketing campaigns

* Strong written English skills

* Highly organized and detail-oriented

* Ability to manage multiple responsibilities daily

* Self-motivated and dependable



---



## Compensation



* Competitive monthly salary (based on experience)

* Performance-based bonuses

* Long-term opportunity

* Growth potential within the company



---



## How to Apply (Important – Read Carefully)



To be considered, please send:



1. A short summary of your Shopify and/or Etsy experience

2. Examples of stores you have managed

3. Your experience with
 marketing platforms

4. Your expected monthly salary

5. A link to your CV or resume showing full work experience

6. Any reference letters or recommendation letters (if available)

7. The phrase “US HOURS STORE MANAGER” at the top of your application



Applications missing the required phrase or resume link will not be reviewed.



---



We are looking for someone dependable, organized, and committed to excellence.



If that’s you, apply now.

title: Marketing Operations & Newsletter Coordinator
description:
We are seeking a highly organized and proactive Marketing Operations & Newsletter Coordinator to become an extension of our in-person marketing team.

The ideal candidate thrives in structured systems, communicates clearly, and is comfortable working independently while staying closely aligned with an in-person team.



We are starting this position as part-time with the potential to grow into full-time based on team needs and performance.



Marketing Operations & Project Oversight

1. Build and maintain a structured project management system using Microsoft Planner

3. Ensure tasks are assigned, tracked, and completed on time

Newsletter Management

 campaigns

Light Design & Production Support

Additional Marketing Support

Qualifications

• Strong proficiency in Canva

• Working knowledge of Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator

• Experience with Microsoft Planner or similar project management tools

• Strong writing (English) and editing skills

• Highly organized and detail-oriented

What Success Looks Like

mber needs to be available during some local work hours.
